Sense.DEF: the 11th letter of the alphabet
Sense.TRAN: 英语字母表的第十一个字母
an abbreviation of 缩写= one thousand 非正式 一千
Sense.EXAMPLE: a salary of £30k a year
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 年薪三万英镑

Sense.TRAN: an abbreviation of 缩写= kilobyte or 或 kilobytes 千字节
a written abbreviation of 书面缩写= kilometre or 或 kilometres 千米﹐公里
Sense.EXAMPLE: a 20k international race walker
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 20公里国际竞走比赛运动员

Sense.TRAN: the abbreviation of 缩写= Kelvin or 或 Kelvins 开〔开尔文温标的计量单位〕

Sense.DEF: an American spelling of kebab
an informal social situation when people drink coffee and talk
a very offensive word for a black person, used by white people in South Africa. Do not use this word.
Sense.TRAN: 黑鬼〔南非白人对黑人的蔑称〕

Sense.DEF: another spelling of caftan
a type of rifle long gunthat can fire very quickly
Sense.TRAN: 卡拉什尼科夫步[冲锋]枪﹐AK47 步[冲锋]枪

Sense.DEF: a dark green vegetable with curled leaves
a pattern, situation, or scene that is always changing and has many details or bright colours
Sense.TRAN: 千变万化的图案[情况﹐景致]

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a kaleidoscope of cultures
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 多姿多彩的文化

Sense.DEF: a tube with mirrors and pieces of coloured glass at one end, which shows coloured patterns when you turn it
kaleidoscopic scenes, colours, or patterns change often and quickly
Sense.TRAN: 〔景致﹑色彩或图案〕千变万化的

Sense.DEF: a pilot who deliberately crashes his plane on enemy camps, ships etc knowing he will be killed
used to describe someone who is willing to take risks, without caring about their safety
Sense.TRAN: 敢于冒险不顾自身安危的﹐自杀性的
Sense.EXAMPLE: kamikaze lorry drivers
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不要命的卡车司机

Sense.DEF: an Australian animal that moves by jumping and carries its babies in a pouch a special pocket of skin on its stomach
an unofficial court that punishes people unfairly
Sense.TRAN: “袋鼠法庭”〔私设的判案不公的法庭〕

Sense.DEF: a type of white clay used in medicine
a very light material like cotton, used for filling soft things like cushions
broken
Sense.EXAMPLE: The TV’s gone kaput.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这台电视机坏了。

Sense.DEF: an activity that people do for entertainment, in which someone sings a popular song while a karaoke machine plays the music to the song
Sense.EXAMPLE: a karaoke bar
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 卡拉OK酒吧

Sense.DEF: an American spelling of carat
a Japanese fighting sport, in which you use your feet and hands to hit and kick
the belief that all the good and bad things that you do in this life affect how good or bad your future lives will be, according to the Hindu and Buddhist religions
Sense.TRAN: 〔印度教﹑佛教中的〕羯磨﹐业〔指现世行为将影响来世命运〕

Sense.DEF: the feeling that you get from a person, place, or action

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The house had a lot of bad karma.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这幢房子充满了不祥的气氛。

Sense.DEF: a small motor vehicle with an open frame and four wheels, used in races
another spelling of khazi
a type of large grasshopper
a type of light boat, usually for one person, that is moved using a paddle

PIC.HEADING: KAYAK 独木舟
PIC.PICCONTENT: paddle 桨；kayak 单人划子；canoe 独木舟

Sense.DEF: a simple musical instrument that you play by holding it to your lips and making sounds into it

Sense.TRAN: a written abbreviation of 书面缩写= kilobyte or 或 kilobytes 千字节

Sense.DEF: the highest level of barrister lawyer who speaks in court in Britain when the ruler is a king
small pieces of meat and vegetables cooked on a stick
a cooked dish of fish, rice, and eggs mixed together
steady, without any sudden changes

GramExa.PROPFORM: keep sth/get sth back on an even keel
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Now that the crisis is over, we must try to get things back on an even keel.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 既然危机已过去﹐我们必须设法使一切都恢复稳定。

Sense.DEF: a bar along the bottom of a boat that keeps it steady in the water
to fall over sideways
Sense.EXAMPLE: Several soldiers keeled over in the hot sun.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 几名士兵在烈日下晕倒了。

Sense.DEF: to punish someone severely – often used humorously
to pull someone under the keel of a ship with a rope as a punishment
Sense.TRAN: 把〔某人〕缚于船底施以拖刑

Sense.DEF: wanting to do something or wanting something to happen very much

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He told me that he was keen to help.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他告诉我说他很想帮忙。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I wasn’t keen on going there on my own.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不想一个人去那里。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The government is keen for peace talks to start again.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 政府渴望重启和平会谈。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The chairman is keen that the company should expand its product range.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 董事长非常希望公司能够增加产品种类。

Sense.DEF: to like someone or something
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’m not keen on cabbage.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不喜欢吃卷心菜。

GramExa.PROPFORM: not too/not very/not that keen on sth
GramExa.EXAMPLE: She likes Biology, but she’s not too keen on Physics.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她喜欢生物学﹐但不大喜欢物理。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: My flatmates want to have a party, but I’m not keen on the idea.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我同公寓的室友想办个派对﹐但我却不喜欢这个主意。

Sense.DEF: someone who is keen on something is very interested in it or enjoys doing it very much
Sense.EXAMPLE: a keen photographer
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个摄影迷
Sense.EXAMPLE: keen golfers
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 热衷于打高尔夫球的人

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Daniel’s very keen on tennis.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 丹尼尔酷爱网球。
GramExa.GLOSS: very keen on something
GramExa.EXAMPLE: I was mad keen on dinosaurs when I was little.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我小时候对恐龙非常着迷。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: She takes a keen interest in politics and current affairs.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她对政治和时事极感兴趣。

Sense.DEF: someone who is keen is eager to work or learn, and enjoys doing it
Sense.TRAN: 〔对工作或学习〕渴望的﹐热衷的
Sense.EXAMPLE: keen students
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 求知若渴的学生
Sense.EXAMPLE: The kids in my class are all very keen.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我班上的学生都很好学。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She was new in the job and keen as mustard very keen.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她刚开始做这工作﹐热情很高。

Sense.DEF: a keen sense of smell or keen sight or hearing is an extremely good ability to smell etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: Dogs have a very keen sense of smell.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 狗的嗅觉十分灵敏。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She has a keen eye for is good at noticing talent.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她擅于发掘人才。

Sense.DEF: someone with a keen mind is quick to understand things
Sense.EXAMPLE: a keen understanding of commerce
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对商业敏锐的理解力
Sense.EXAMPLE: With her keen mind and good business sense, she soon became noticed.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 凭着敏捷的思维和良好的商业头脑﹐她不久就引起了注意。

Sense.DEF: a keen feeling is one that is strong and deep
Sense.EXAMPLE: As she walked away, Joe felt a keen sense of loss.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她走了﹐乔感到一阵强烈的失落感。

Sense.DEF: used to describe a situation in which people compete strongly
Sense.EXAMPLE: We won the contest in the face of keen competition.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 面对激烈的竞争﹐我们还是赢得了比赛。

Sense.DEF: to be sexually attracted to someone
a keen knife or blade is extremely sharp
a keen wind is cold and strong
keen prices are low

RunOn.EXAMPLE: I was keenly aware of the dangers.

Sense.DEF: to sing a loud sad song for someone who has died
to stay in a particular state, condition, or position, or to make someone or something do this

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We huddled around the fire to keep warm.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们挤在火堆边取暖。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I was struggling to keep awake.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我努力不让自己睡着。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Keep your room tidy.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 保持房间整洁。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: some toys to keep the kids amused
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一些供孩子消遣的玩具
GramExa.EXAMPLE: You won’t be able to keep it secret for ever.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你不可能永远保密下去。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Peter cycles to work to keep fit.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 为了保持健康﹐彼得骑自行车上班。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Don’t keep us in suspense any longer!
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 别再让我们心里悬着了！

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The police put up barriers to keep the crowds back.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 警方设置了障碍物来挡住人群。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: If I were you, I’d keep away from that area at night.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 要是我的话﹐晚上就不会去那个地区。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: a sign saying ‘Danger: Keep out’
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 写着“危险﹐请勿靠近”字样的告示牌
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The little boy kept close to his mother.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 那个小男孩总黏着他妈妈。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Keep him out of trouble.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 别让他闯祸。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: You keep out of this, Mother do not get involved. It’s no concern of yours.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 妈妈﹐这事你别掺和。不关你的事。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: How can I cut your hair if you won’t keep still!
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你老是动来动去的﹐叫我怎么给你剪头发！

GramExa.GLOSS: stay to the left or right of a path or road as you move

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Jane kept the engine running.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 简让引擎保持运转。

Sense.DEF: to continue doing something or to do the same thing many times

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I keep thinking about Joe, all alone in that place.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我老是想到乔﹐他独自一人在那种地方。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: I keep telling you, but you won’t listen!
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我一再跟你说﹐但你就是不肯听！
GramExa.EXAMPLE: She pretended not to hear, and kept on walking.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她假装没听见﹐继续往前走。
GramExa.HINTTRAN: Do not say 不要说 ‘keep up’ doing something. Say 而要说 keep doing something or 或 keep on doing something.

Sense.DEF: to have something and not give it back to the person who had it before
Sense.EXAMPLE: You can keep it. I don’t need it any more.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你留着吧﹐我不需要了。

Sense.DEF: to continue to have something and not lose it or get rid of it
Sense.EXAMPLE: We decided to keep our old car instead of selling it.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们决定留着我们的旧汽车不卖。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I kept his letters for years.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我把他的信保留了许多年。
Sense.EXAMPLE: In spite of everything, Robyn’s managed to keep her sense of humor.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 尽管发生了这一切﹐萝宾还是努力保持了她的幽默感。

Sense.DEF: to leave something in one particular place so that you can find it easily
Sense.EXAMPLE: Where do you keep your teabags?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你把茶包放哪儿啦？
Sense.EXAMPLE: George kept a bottle of whiskey under his bed.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 乔治在床底下放了一瓶威士忌。

Sense.SIGNPOST: MAKE SB STAY IN A PLACE
Sense.DEF: to make someone stay in a place, especially a prison or hospital
Sense.TRAN: 监禁﹐关押﹐拘留〔尤在监狱或医院里〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: He was kept in prison for a week without charge.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他被关押了一个星期﹐但没被起诉。

Sense.DEF: to delay someone
Sense.EXAMPLE: He should be here by now. What’s keeping him?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他现在本该到这儿了﹐什么事把他耽搁了？

Sense.DEF: to do what you have promised or agreed to do

GramExa.EXAMPLE: How do I know you’ll keep your word?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我怎么知道你会说话算话？

Sense.EXAMPLE: patients who fail to keep their appointments
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 未能如约来就诊的病人

Sense.DEF: to not tell anyone about a secret that you know
Sense.EXAMPLE: Can I trust you to keep a secret?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我能相信你会保守秘密吗？

Sense.DEF: to not say anything in order to avoid telling a secret or causing problems
Sense.TRAN: 别把某事说出去/(对某事)保密

Sense.DEF: to regularly record written information somewhere
Sense.TRAN: 定期记录/记账/写日记等

Subsense.DEF: to have or to give someone enough hope and emotional strength to continue living and doing things in a bad situation
Subsense.TRAN: (使某人)坚持活下去﹐(使某人)尽力维持下去
Subsense.EXAMPLE: That woman’s been through such a lot – I don’t know how she keeps going.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那女人经历了这么多磨难﹐我不知道她是怎么坚持下来的。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Her letters were the only thing that kept me going while I was in prison.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我在监狱里的时候﹐她的信是我坚持下去的唯一动力。

Subsense.DEF: if you keep a business, institution, regular event etc going, you keep it open or make it continue to happen
Subsense.EXAMPLE: The library costs £5 million a year to run, and the council can’t afford to keep it going.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这家图书馆每年经费达500万英镑﹐市政会无力维持。

Subsense.DEF: to continue doing something difficult
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Persevere and keep going until you reach your ideal weight.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 咬紧牙关坚持下去﹐直至达到你的理想体重为止。

Subsense.DEF: if something keeps you going, it is enough to satisfy your need while you are waiting to get something bigger or better
Subsense.EXAMPLE: I’ll have a biscuit to keep me going until dinner time.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我要吃一块饼干﹐好支撑到正餐时间。

Sense.DEF: if food keeps, it stays fresh enough to be eaten
Sense.EXAMPLE: Eat the salmon because it won’t keep till tomorrow.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 把三文鱼吃了吧﹐搁不到明天的。

Sense.DEF: to own and look after animals
Sense.EXAMPLE: We keep chickens and a couple of pigs.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们养了一些鸡和几头猪。

Sense.SIGNPOST: STOP OTHER PEOPLE FROM USING STH
Sense.DEF: to stop other people from using something, so that it is available for someone
Sense.EXAMPLE: Will you keep a seat for me?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你能否给我留个座位？

Sense.DEF: to make someone wait before you meet them or see them
Sense.EXAMPLE: Sorry to keep you waiting – I got stuck in a meeting.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 很抱歉让你久等了﹐我刚开会脱不了身。

Sense.DEF: to guard a place or watch around you all the time
to own a small business and work in it
to provide someone with money, food etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: He did not earn enough to keep a wife and children.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他赚的钱不够养活妻儿。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: There’s enough money there to keep you in champagne for a year!
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 那些钱够你喝上一年的香槟！

Sense.DEF: to guard or protect someone
Sense.EXAMPLE: The Lord bless you and keep you.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 上帝赐福于你并保佑你。
Sense.EXAMPLE: His only thought was to keep the child from harm.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他唯一的念头就是要保护孩子不受到伤害。

Sense.DEF: to be the player in a team whose job is to protect the goal or wicket
used to tell someone not to say anything or make any noise
Sense.EXAMPLE: Keep quiet! I’m trying to watch the game.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 安静！我要看比赛。

Sense.DEF: used to ask if someone is well
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘Hi, Mark! How are you keeping?’ ‘Oh, not so bad.’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “嗨﹐马克！你怎么样？”“噢﹐马马虎虎。”

Sense.DEF: used to tell someone to be more calm, patient etc
used to say that you do not want or are not interested in something
Sense.TRAN: 由某人去做某事〔表示你对某事不感兴趣〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: She can keep her wild parties and posh friends – I like the quiet life.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 随她去参加各种狂野派对﹑交富贵朋友吧﹐我喜欢过安静的生活。

Sense.DEF: used to say that you can tell someone something or do something later
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘I don’t have time to listen now.’ ‘Don’t worry, it’ll keep‧’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “我现在没时间听。”“别担心﹐以后再告诉你。”

Sense.DEF: to continue to do something, although it is difficult or hard work
Sense.EXAMPLE: I know it’s hard, but keep at it! Don’t give up!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我知道这不容易﹐但要坚持下去！别放弃！

Sense.DEF: to force someone to continue to work hard and not let them stop
Sense.TRAN: 强迫某人继续苦干某事

Sense.DEF: to deliberately not tell someone all that you know about something
Sense.EXAMPLE: I got the feeling he was keeping something back.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我感觉他隐瞒着一些事情。

Sense.DEF: to not show your feelings, even though you want to very much
Sense.EXAMPLE: She was struggling to keep back the tears.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她在强忍泪水。

Sense.DEF: to prevent someone from being as successful as they could be
Sense.TRAN: 阻止[妨碍]某人发展[进步]
Sense.EXAMPLE: Fear and stereotypes have kept women back for centuries.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 恐惧和陈规已经束缚了女性数百年。

Sense.DEF: to not give or pay something that you were going to give
Sense.EXAMPLE: They kept back some of his wages to pay for the damage.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们扣下了他的一部分工资来赔偿损失。

Sense.DEF: to prevent the size, cost, or quantity of something from increasing or being too great
Sense.EXAMPLE: We need to keep costs down.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们需要控制成本。

Sense.DEF: to succeed in keeping food in your stomach, instead of bringing it up again out of your mouth, when you are ill
Sense.EXAMPLE: I could hardly keep anything down for about three days.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 大概有三天时间﹐我几乎是吃什么吐什么。

Sense.DEF: used to ask someone to make less noise
Sense.EXAMPLE: Keep your voice down – she’ll hear you!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 小点声﹐她会听到的！
Sense.EXAMPLE: Can you keep it down – I’m trying to work.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你能不能安静一点﹐我要工作。

Sense.DEF: to prevent a group of people from becoming as successful and powerful as the other people in a society
Sense.EXAMPLE: Plantation owners kept slaves down by refusing them an education.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 种植园主不让奴隶受教育﹐以此来控制他们。

Sense.DEF: to prevent someone from doing something or prevent something from happening
Sense.TRAN: 不让(某人)做某事﹔不让(某事)发生

GramExa.EXAMPLE: His ex-wife had kept him from seeing his children.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的前妻不让他看孩子。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: I hope I haven’t kept you from your work.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 希望我没有妨碍你工作。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Put the pizza in the bottom of the oven to keep the cheese from burning.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 把比萨饼放在烤箱底部﹐以免奶酪烤煳。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The play was so boring, I could hardly keep myself from falling asleep.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这出戏太乏味了﹐我差点睡着。

Sense.DEF: to prevent someone from knowing something, by deliberately not telling them about it
Sense.TRAN: 不让某人知道某事﹐对某人隐瞒某事
Sense.EXAMPLE: The government had wanted to keep this information from the public.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 政府本想对公众隐瞒这一消息。

Sense.DEF: to make someone stay in hospital because they are too ill to go home
Sense.EXAMPLE: They kept her in overnight for observation.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们让她留院观察一夜。

Sense.DEF: to force someone to stay inside, especially as a punishment in school
Sense.TRAN: 使〔某人〕留在屋里﹔〔尤指〕罚〔某人〕课后留校

Sense.DEF: to try to stay friendly with someone, especially because this helps you
Sense.TRAN: 与〔某人〕友好相处〔尤因这样做对自己有利〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s a good idea to keep in with the boss.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 与老板维持良好关系是个好主意。

Sense.DEF: to prevent something from touching or harming something
Sense.EXAMPLE: She held an old piece of cloth over them both to keep the rain off.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她拿着一块旧布盖在他俩身上挡雨。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: How are we going to keep the flies off this food?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们怎样才能不让苍蝇飞到食物上去？

Sense.DEF: used to tell someone not to touch someone or something
Sense.EXAMPLE: Keep your hands off me!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 别碰我！

Sense.DEF: to not eat, drink, or take something that is bad for you, or to stop someone else from eating, drinking, or taking it
Sense.TRAN: (使某人)不去吃[喝﹐服用]有害的东西
Sense.EXAMPLE: Keep off fatty foods.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不吃高脂食物。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a programme aimed at keeping teenagers off drugs
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一项旨在使青少年远离毒品的计划

Sense.DEF: to avoid talking about a particular subject, especially so that you do not upset someone
Sense.TRAN: 避开某一话题〔以免激怒别人〕

Sense.DEF: if you keep weight off, you do not get heavier again after you have lost weight
if rain keeps off, it does not fall
to continue doing something, or to do something many times
Sense.EXAMPLE: You just have to keep on trying.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你只得继续努力。

Sense.DEF: to continue to employ someone, especially for longer than you had planned
Sense.TRAN: 继续雇用某人﹐留用某人〔尤指比原定时间长〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: If you’re good, they might keep you on after Christmas.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你如果表现不错﹐圣诞节后他们或许还会接着用你。

Sense.DEF: to talk continuously about something or repeat something many times, in a way that is annoying

GramExa.EXAMPLE: There’s no need to keep on and on about it!
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 没必要对这件事纠缠不休！

GramExa.EXAMPLE: If I didn’t keep on at the children, they’d never do their homework.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 要不是我盯着孩子们﹐他们永远不会做家庭作业。

Sense.DEF: to stay on a particular road, course, piece of ground etc
Sense.TRAN: 不离开〔某一道路﹑方向﹑地方等〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s best to keep to the paths.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 最好沿着小路走。

Sense.DEF: to do what has been decided in an agreement or plan, or what is demanded by law
Sense.EXAMPLE: Keep to the speed limits.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 遵守限速规定。

Sense.DEF: to talk or write only about the subject you are supposed to be talking about
to prevent an amount, degree, or level from becoming higher than it should
Sense.TRAN: 把某物限定在〔某一数量﹑程度或水平上〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Costs must be kept to a minimum.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 成本必须降到最低。

Sense.DEF: to not tell anyone about something
Sense.TRAN: 对某事保密﹐绝口不提某事
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’d appreciate it if you kept it to yourself.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果你能对此事保密﹐我不胜感激。

Sense.DEF: to live a very quiet private life and not do many things that involve other people
to continue doing something
Sense.EXAMPLE: I don’t think I can keep this up any longer.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我觉得我再也无法坚持下去了。

GramExa.GLOSS: continue to work hard and well

Sense.DEF: if a situation keeps up, it continues without stopping or changing
Sense.EXAMPLE: How long can the economic boom keep up?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 经济繁荣能持续多久？

Sense.DEF: to go as quickly as someone else

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I had to walk fast to keep up with him.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我要快走才能跟上他。

Sense.DEF: to manage to do as much or as well as other people

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Jack’s having trouble keeping up with the rest of the class.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 杰克很难跟上班里的其他同学。

GramExa.GLOSS: try to have the same new impressive possessions that other people have

Sense.DEF: to continue to read and learn about a particular subject, so that you always know about the most recent facts, products etc

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Employees need to keep up with the latest technical developments.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 员工需要跟上最新的技术发展。

Sense.DEF: to make something continue at its present level or amount, instead of letting it decrease
Sense.EXAMPLE: NATO kept up the pressure on the Serbs to get out of Kosovo.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 北约继续对塞尔维亚人施加压力﹐敦促他们撤出科索沃。

Sense.DEF: if one process keeps up with another, it increases at the same speed and by the same amount

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Food production is not keeping up with population growth.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 粮食产量未能跟上人口增长的速度。

Sense.DEF: to continue to practise a skill so that you do not lose it
Sense.EXAMPLE: I used to speak French, but I haven’t kept it up.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我以前会说法语﹐但是没有坚持练习。

Sense.DEF: to prevent someone from going to bed
Sense.EXAMPLE: I hope I’m not keeping you up.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 希望我没有耽误你睡觉。

Sense.DEF: to stay happy, strong, confident etc by making an effort
Sense.TRAN: 保持高昂的情绪/体力/士气等
Sense.EXAMPLE: We sang as we marched, to keep our spirits up.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们唱着歌行进﹐以保持高昂的情绪。

Sense.DEF: to pretend that everything in your life is normal and happy even though you are in trouble, especially financial trouble
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指尽管遇到钱财方面的麻烦仍〕佯装若无其事﹔装门面

Sense.DEF: to write to, telephone, or meet a friend regularly, so that you do not forget each other
the cost of providing food and a home for someone

GramExa.GLOSS: do things in return for the things that are provided for you
GramExa.EXAMPLE: It’s time you got a job and started earning your keep.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你该去找份工作养活自己了。

Sense.DEF: forever
Sense.EXAMPLE: Marriage ought to be for keeps.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 婚姻应当是天长地久的。

Sense.DEF: a large strong tower, usually in the centre of a castle
a children's game in which you try to catch a ball that is being thrown between two other people
Sense.TRAN: 〔儿童的〕抢球游戏〔截住另外两人之间抛接的球〕

Sense.DEF: someone who looks after animals
Sense.EXAMPLE: a beekeeper
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 养蜂人
Sense.EXAMPLE: Bob is head lion keeper at the zoo.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 鲍勃是动物园养狮主管。

Sense.DEF: someone whose job is to look after a particular place or thing
Sense.EXAMPLE: a lighthouse keeper
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 灯塔管理员

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the keeper of Greek coins in the British Museum
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 大英博物馆内的古希腊钱币保管员

Sense.DEF: a goalkeeper
used to say that you are not responsible for someone else’s actions
Sense.TRAN: 我又不是某人的监护者〔用于表示你对某人的行为不负责〕

Sense.DEF: a class in which you do exercises to keep yourself healthy
the activity of making a football go up and down in the air many times without touching the ground, using short light kicks to control the ball’s movements
matching something, or suitable in a particular situation
Sense.TRAN: 与(某事物)一致﹔适合〔某情况〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: In keeping with tradition, everyone wore black.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 按照传统﹐所有人都身着黑色的衣服。

Sense.DEF: not matching something or not suitable in a particular situation
Sense.TRAN: 与(某事物)不一致[不符合]﹔不适合〔某情况〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: The cheerful cover of the book is out of keeping with the sad story told inside it.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这本书活泼的封面和书中悲伤的故事不相称。

Sense.DEF: being looked after or guarded by someone
a small object that you keep to remind you of someone
a piece of cloth traditionally worn on the head by Arab men
a round wooden or metal container with a flat top and bottom, used for storing beer

GramExa.GLOSS: beer served from a keg

Sense.DEF: a big outdoor party where beer is served from kegs
your buttocks the part of your body that you sit on
a type of flat brown seaweed a plant that grows in the sea
a scale of temperature in which water freezes at 273.15 K and boils at 373.15 K
Sense.TRAN: 开〔开尔文温标的计量单位〕

Sense.DEF: if something is beyond your ken, you have no knowledge or understanding of it
Sense.TRAN: 超出了你的知识范围[理解程度]
Sense.EXAMPLE: mysteries beyond our ken
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们无法理解的神秘事物

Sense.DEF: a small building made for a dog to sleep in
a place where dogs are kept for breeding or are cared for while their owners are away
Sense.TRAN: 狗繁殖场﹔〔主人外出时寄养狗的〕养狗场

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The puppy, which may have rabies, is at a quarantine kennel.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这只幼犬可能得了狂犬病﹐被关在隔离站。

Sense.DEF: a game played in casinos, in which you try to win money by guessing which num­bers a computer will choose
Sense.TRAN: 基诺〔赌场内的一种赌博游戏〕

Sense.DEF: a famous race for three-year-old horses that is held each year on the first Saturday in May in Louisville, Kentucky. It is part of the Triple Crown.
Sense.TRAN: 肯塔基德比赛马会〔每年5月第一个星期六在肯塔基州路易斯维尔举行的著名三龄马比赛﹐为三冠赛之一〕

Sense.DEF: the past tense and past participle of keep
Sense.TRAN: keep 的过去式和过去分词

Sense.DEF: a woman who is given a place to live, money, and clothes by a man who visits her for sex – often used humorously
Sense.TRAN: 被包养的情妇﹐姘妇〔常为幽默用法〕

Sense.DEF: the edge of the pavement raised path at the side of a road
Sense.EXAMPLE: His car mounted the kerb and ploughed into a bus queue.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的汽车冲上路缘﹐撞到了排队等候公共汽车的人。

Sense.DEF: a man who drives his car slowly along the road looking for a prostitute a women who has sex for money
Sense.TRAN: 驾车沿路缓行招妓的人

RunOn.EXAMPLE: He was arrested for kerb crawling.
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 他因驾车沿街招妓而遭逮捕。

Sense.DEF: a square piece of cloth, worn on the head or around the neck
a sound like that made by a till in a shop – used to say that someone or something is getting a lot of money
Sense.TRAN: 哗哗地来钱﹐钱财滚滚来
Sense.EXAMPLE: There were people lined up around the block on the movie’s opening night – kerching!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这部电影首映夜排队的人都绕过街区了﹐真是票房大卖啊！

Sense.DEF: unnecessary noise and activity
the part of a nut or seed inside the shell, or the part inside the stone of some fruits
one of the small yellow pieces on a corn cob
the most important part of a statement, idea, plan etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔陈述﹑观点﹑计划等的〕核心﹐中心﹐要点

GramExa.EXAMPLE: This evidence is the kernel of the defendants’ case.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这项证据是被告辩护中的关键点。

Sense.DEF: a very small part or amount of something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: There may be a kernel of truth in what he says.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他说的话也可能有点真实的成分。

Sense.DEF: a clear oil that is burnt to provide heat or light
Sense.EXAMPLE: a kerosene lamp
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 煤油灯

Sense.DEF: a type of bird that is like a small falcon
a substance designed as an anaesthetic and painkiller, that some people use as an illegal drug
Sense.TRAN: 氯胺酮〔一种麻醉剂和止痛药﹐一些人当成毒品吸食〕

Sense.DEF: a small sailing ship with two masts
a thick cold red sauce made from tomatoes that you put on food
Sense.EXAMPLE: a bottle of tomato ketchup
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一瓶番茄酱

Sense.DEF: a container with a lid, a handle, and a spout,used for boiling and pouring water
Sense.EXAMPLE: She filled the kettle and switched it on.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她把水壶灌满﹐打开了开关。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The kettle’s boiling the water in it is boiling.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 水壶里的水开了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Put the kettle on start boiling water in a kettle, will you?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 烧壶水﹐好吗？

Sense.DEF: a large pot, used for making soup
used to say that a situation is very different from one that you have just mentioned
Sense.EXAMPLE: She enjoys public speaking, but being on TV is a different kettle of fish.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她喜欢当众演讲﹐但上电视又是另一回事了。

Sense.DEF: a large metal drum with a round bottom, used in an orchestra.A set of kettledrums is called timpani.
a type of plastic doll from America with a fat body and a curl of hair on its head
Sense.TRAN: 丘比娃娃〔身体肥胖﹑头发卷曲的塑料娃娃〕

Sense.DEF: very important or necessary
Sense.TRAN: 至关重要的﹔必不可少的﹔关键的
Sense.EXAMPLE: China’s support is key to the success of the coalition.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 中国的支持是联盟成功的关键。

GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 关键的因素/论点/问题等

Sense.EXAMPLE: The President makes all the key decisions on foreign policy.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 外交政策上的所有重要决定都由总统作出。

GramExa.GLOSS: one with a lot of influence on a result
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The show has been hit by the departure of key personnel.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 由于主要人员离去﹐演出受到了影响。

Sense.DEF: a small specially shaped piece of metal that you put into a lock and turn in order to lock or unlock a door, start a car etc

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I lost my house keys.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我把家里的钥匙弄丢了。

Sense.EXAMPLE: A bunch of keys hung from his belt.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的皮带上挂着一串钥匙。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I can lend you a spare key to the store until you get one cut made.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 在你配好钥匙之前﹐我可以借给你一把商店的备用钥匙。

Sense.HINTTRAN: Do not say 不要说 ‘the key of’ something. Say 而要说 the key to something.

Sense.DEF: the part of a plan, action etc that will make it possible for it to succeed

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Working well as a team is the key to success.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 良好的团队合作是成功的关键。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: a discovery that may hold the key to our understanding of the universe
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 也许能开启我们认识宇宙之门的一个发现

Sense.DEF: the buttons that you press on a computer keyboard to operate the computer
Sense.EXAMPLE: Press the ‘Escape’ key to exit.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 按退出键退出。

GramExa.GLOSS: a special key on a computer, that does specific things

Subsense.DEF: the wooden or metal parts that you press on a piano and some wind instruments in order to play them
Subsense.EXAMPLE: piano keys
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 钢琴键

Subsense.DEF: a scale of notes that begins with one particular note, or the quality of sound this scale has
Subsense.EXAMPLE: a tune in the key of A minor
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一段A小调的曲子

Sense.DEF: a list of the signs, colours etc used on a map or technical drawing etc that explains what they mean
the printed answers to a test or set of questions in a book
a small flat island, especially one that is part of a group near the coast
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指靠近海岸的群岛中的〕小岛﹐低岛
Sense.EXAMPLE: the Florida Keys
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 佛罗里达群岛

Sense.DEF: if you key a win for your team, you help it win a game because you play very well
Sense.EXAMPLE: Abdul keyed the game with three touchdowns.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 阿布杜尔三次触地得分﹐是赢得比赛的关键。

Sense.DEF: to prepare a surface so that a covering such as paint will stick to it
Sense.TRAN: 〔为涂油漆等〕将…的表面处理好

Sense.DEF: to put information into a com­puter or other machine, using buttons or a keyboard
Sense.EXAMPLE: Key in your password and press ‘Return’.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 键入密码﹐按回车键。

Sense.DEF: to make or change a system so that it works well with something else
Sense.EXAMPLE: The daycare hours are keyed to the needs of working parents.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 日间托儿服务的时间根据上班家长的需要而定。

Sense.DEF: if the level, price, or value of something is keyed to something else, it is related to it and they rise and fall at the same time
Sense.TRAN: 将〔水平﹑价格或价值〕与…相联系[挂钩]
Sense.EXAMPLE: Pensions are keyed to the rate of inflation.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 养老金和通货膨胀率挂钩。

Sense.DEF: a board with buttons marked with letters or numbers that are pressed to put information into a computer or other machine
Sense.EXAMPLE: a computer keyboard
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 计算机键盘

Sense.DEF: the row of keys on some musical instruments that you press in order to play them
an electronic musical instrument similar to a piano that can make sounds like many different instruments
Sense.EXAMPLE: Chris Kelly (guitar) and Benny Hayes (keyboards and vocals)
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 克里斯·凯利(吉他手)和本尼·海斯(键盘手和主唱)

PIC.HEADING: KEYBOARDS 键盘
PIC.PICCONTENT: computer keyboard 计算机键盘；electronic keyboard 电子琴

Sense.DEF: to put information into a computer, using a keyboard
Sense.EXAMPLE: keyboarding errors
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 输入错误

Sense.DEF: someone whose job is to put information into a computer, using a keyboard
Sense.TRAN: 键盘输入员﹐键盘操作员

Sense.DEF: someone who plays the keyboard
a special plastic card that you put in an electronic lock to open a door etc
a chain with a key ring attached, used for holding keys
worried or excited

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Travis was keyed up at the thought of seeing Rosie again.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 想到又要见到罗茜﹐特拉维斯就很紧张。

Sense.DEF: someone who is officially responsible for keeping the key to an office building, factory etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔办公大楼﹑工厂等的〕钥匙保管员

Sense.DEF: the hole in a lock that you put the key in
Sense.EXAMPLE: I peeped through the keyhole and watched them.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我从钥匙孔偷看他们。

Sense.DEF: medical operations done through a very small hole in the body
the main point in a book, system of beliefs, activity etc that influences everything else

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Unprecedented change has been the keynote of the electronic revolution.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 电子革命的要义就是前所未有的变革。

Sense.DEF: relating to the most important part of a formal meeting, report etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔正式会议﹑报告等〕主要的﹐基调的

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He is scheduled to deliver the keynote address at an awards ceremony.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他被安排在颁奖典礼上作主题发言。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Bill Gates is booked as the keynote speaker.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 比尔·盖茨被定为主题发言人。

Sense.DEF: to give the keynote speech at a formal meeting, ceremony etc
Sense.TRAN: (在)〔正式会议﹑典礼等上〕作主题发言
Sense.EXAMPLE: The event is usually keynoted by the prime minister.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个活动通常由首相作主题发言。

Sense.DEF: a small box with buttons on it, used to put information into a computer, telephone etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔计算机﹑电话等的〕小键盘﹔辅助键盘

Sense.DEF: someone with whom you regularly exchange email
Sense.TRAN: 〔经常有电子邮件往来的〕键友﹐网上笔友
Sense.EXAMPLE: If your daughter is interested in having a keypal next year, please have her get in touch.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果你女儿明年想要在网上交个笔友﹐请让她联系。

Sense.DEF: a metal ring that you keep keys on
a set of marks at the beginning of a line of written music to show which key it is in
the large central stone in an arch that keeps the other stones in position
the most important part of an idea, belief, or process that influences how it develops
Sense.TRAN: 〔观点﹑信仰﹑进程等的〕基础﹐主旨﹐基石

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The keystone of any personal injury case is medical evidence.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 裁定人身伤害案的基础是医学证据。

Sense.DEF: a group of characters in humorous US silent films. They are police officers who are very stupid and are always making silly mistakes. A group of people, especially policemen, are sometimes compared to the Keystone Cops if they fail to do something properly because they have made stupid mistakes.
Sense.TRAN: 启斯东警察﹐无能警察〔美国滑稽默片中的角色﹐常喻指一群因犯了愚蠢的错误而办不好事情的人﹐尤指警察〕

Sense.DEF: the action of pressing a key on a computer or other machine
Sense.TRAN: 〔对计算机或其他机器的〕按键﹐击键

Sense.DEF: a word that you type into a computer so that it will search for that word on the Internet
Sense.EXAMPLE: You can find the site by entering the keyword ‘Quark’.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 键入关键词Quark 你就可以找到该网站。

Sense.TRAN: the written abbreviation of 书面缩写= kilogram or 或 kilograms 千克﹐公斤

Sense.DEF: a dull green-brown or yellow-brown colour
Sense.TRAN: 暗绿色﹔土黄色﹐卡其黄﹐黄褐色

Sense.DEF: cloth of this colour, especially when worn by soldiers
trousers made of khaki cloth
another spelling of caliph
a ruler or official in India or central Asia, or their title
Sense.TRAN: 可汗﹐汗〔印度或中亚的统治者或官员﹐或其称号〕

Sense.DEF: a toilet

Sense.TRAN: the written abbreviation of 书面缩写= kilohertz 千赫(兹)

Sense.DEF: small round pieces of dried dog or cat food
a type of farm in Israel where many people live and work together
to make unhelpful remarks while someone is doing something
to talk about things that everyone already knows in a boring way
Sense.EXAMPLE: incessant philosophical kibitzing
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有关哲学的连篇废话

RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 那帮平时废话连篇的人

Sense.DEF: the direction towards which Muslims turn when they pray
to stop a plan, idea etc from developing
Sense.TRAN: 阻止某事物﹔破坏某事物

Sense.DEF: to hit something with your foot

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Billy was kicking a ball around the yard.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 比利在院子里踢球。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The police kicked the door down.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 警察踢倒了门。

GramExa.PROPFORM: kick sb in the stomach/face/shin etc
GramExa.EXAMPLE: There was a scuffle and he kicked me in the stomach.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们打起来了﹐他一脚踢在我肚子上。

Sense.DEF: to move your legs as if you were kicking something
Sense.EXAMPLE: He kicked off his shoes and lay back on the bed.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他踢掉鞋子﹐躺倒在床上。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a row of dancers kicking their legs in the air
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 做腾空踢腿动作的一排舞蹈演员
Sense.EXAMPLE: A horse trotted past, kicking up dust from the road.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一匹马小跑而过﹐扬起了一路尘土。

Sense.DEF: used to say that you are annoyed with yourself because you have done something silly, made a mistake etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔因做了蠢事﹑犯了错等〕责备自己﹐生自己的气
Sense.EXAMPLE: You’ll kick yourself when I tell you the answer.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 等我把答案告诉你﹐你会懊恼的。
Sense.EXAMPLE: United will be kicking themselves for missing several chances.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 联队将因错过多次机会而自责。

Sense.DEF: to stop doing something that is a harmful habit, such as smoking, taking drugs etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: The scheme helps smokers to kick the habit.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这项计划帮助烟民戒烟。

Sense.LEXUNIT: kick sb when they are down
Sense.DEF: to criticize or attack someone who is already in a weak or difficult position
Sense.EXAMPLE: The media can’t resist kicking a man when he’s down.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 媒体忍不住要干落井下石的事。

Sense.DEF: to disappoint someone or treat them badly at a time when they need help
Sense.TRAN: 使某人非常失望﹔粗暴地对待某人〔指在其需要帮助之时〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: We all have times when life kicks us in the teeth.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们都有生活不如意的时候。

Sense.DEF: to punish or defeat someone
Sense.EXAMPLE: We’re gonna kick San Francisco’s ass good tonight.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 今晚我们要好好教训一下旧金山队。

Sense.DEF: used to say that someone or something is very good or impressive
Sense.EXAMPLE: Tucson pop band Shoebomb kick some serious ass.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 图森市的流行乐队Shoebomb 非常棒。

Sense.DEF: to waste time waiting for something
Sense.EXAMPLE: We were left kicking our heels for half the day.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 让我们白等了半天。

Sense.DEF: to enjoy yourself a lot at a party, event etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔在聚会﹑活动等中〕玩得很高兴﹐尽情享乐
Sense.EXAMPLE: The charity ball is a chance to kick up your heels and help a good cause.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 慈善舞会是让人既玩得痛快又能帮着做好事的一次机会。

Sense.DEF: to stop a plan or project before it is completed
Sense.EXAMPLE: A hitch resulted in the deal being kicked firmly into touch.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个小问题使得这笔交易彻底中止了。

Sense.DEF: to complain loudly about something
Sense.EXAMPLE: Won’t he kick up a fuss when he discovers they’re missing?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他发觉它们不见了的话会不会闹起来？

Sense.DEF: protesting violently or being very unwilling to do something
Sense.EXAMPLE: The London Stock Exchange was dragged kicking and screaming into the 20th century.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 伦敦证券交易所极不情愿地被拖进了20世纪。

Sense.LEXUNIT: kick the shit out of sb
Sense.DEF: to hurt someone very badly by kicking them many times
to hurt or damage yourself by trying to change something that cannot be changed
to move someone to a new job that seems to be more important than their last one, but that actually gives them less influence
Sense.TRAN: 把某人明升暗降﹐把某人提升到有职无权的职位上

Sense.DEF: to be relaxing and having a good time
Sense.EXAMPLE: I was just kicking with my buddies.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我正和伙伴们玩得开心。

Sense.DEF: to be having a romantic or sexual relationship with someone

GramExa.EXAMPLE: My sources say that she was kicking it with Thomas while she was on tour.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我听到消息﹐说她在旅途中和托马斯好上了。

Sense.DEF: to start behaving badly by refusing to accept any control or rules
to die – used humorously
to react strongly against something
Sense.EXAMPLE: She has kicked out against authority all her life.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她一生都在反抗权威。

Sense.DEF: to think about or discuss an idea before making a decision
Sense.EXAMPLE: We kicked that suggestion around and in the end decided to go ahead.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们讨论了那个提议﹐最后决定着手进行。

Sense.DEF: to treat someone badly and unfairly
Sense.TRAN: 粗暴地对待某人﹐虐待某人﹐欺凌某人
Sense.EXAMPLE: I have my pride, you know. They can’t kick me around.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 要知道﹐我也是有自尊心的﹐他们不能欺侮我。

Sense.DEF: to be in a place doing things, but without any firm plans
Sense.TRAN: 毫无计划地做(某事)﹐漫无目的地做(某事)
Sense.EXAMPLE: He kicked around India for a few months.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他在印度游荡了几个月。

Sense.DEF: to be left in a place untidily or forgotten
Sense.EXAMPLE: There’s a copy of the report kicking around somewhere.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 报告有一份副本放在什么地方了。

Sense.DEF: to relax
Sense.EXAMPLE: Your waitress will take your order while you kick back and enjoy the game.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 服务员会来请你点菜的﹐你尽管轻松愉快地玩游戏吧。

Sense.DEF: to start or to begin to have an effect
Sense.EXAMPLE: The storm is expected to kick in shortly after sunrise.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 预计风暴将在日出后不久到来。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The painkillers kicked in and he became sleepy.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 止痛药开始起作用﹐他昏昏欲睡了。

Sense.DEF: to join with others in giving money or help
Sense.EXAMPLE: Bill never wants to kick in.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 比尔从来都不肯出力。
Sense.EXAMPLE: We were each asked to kick in 50 cents toward the cost.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们每个人都被要求出50美分分摊这笔费用。

Sense.DEF: to injure someone badly by kicking them
Sense.EXAMPLE: He threatened to come round and kick my head in.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他威胁说要过来踢死我。

Sense.DEF: to kick a locked door so hard that it breaks open
Sense.EXAMPLE: We had to get the police to kick the door in.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们只得叫警察来把门踢开。

Sense.DEF: if a meeting, event, or a football game kicks off, it starts
Sense.TRAN: 〔会议﹑活动〕开始﹔〔足球比赛〕开球
Sense.EXAMPLE: What time does the laser show kick off?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 激光表演什么时候开始？
Sense.EXAMPLE: The match kicks off at noon.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 比赛中午开始。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The series kicked off with an interview with Brando.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 该系列节目一开始是对白兰度的采访。

Sense.DEF: if you kick off a discussion, meeting, event etc, you start it
Sense.EXAMPLE: OK Marion, would you care to kick off?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 好的﹐玛丽昂﹐你要现在开始吗？

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I’m going to kick off today’s meeting with a few remarks about the budget.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 今天的会议我先就预算讲几句。

Sense.DEF: to remove someone from a team or group
Sense.TRAN: 从〔队伍或团体中〕开除[逐出]某人
Sense.EXAMPLE: Joe was kicked off the committee for stealing funds.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 乔因窃取资金而被逐出委员会。

Sense.DEF: to die
if a fight kicks off, people start fighting
Sense.EXAMPLE: I think it might kick off in here with all these football fans around.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这么多球迷聚在这里﹐我觉得他们可能会打起来。

Sense.DEF: to make someone leave a place, job etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: Bernard’s wife kicked him out.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 伯纳德的老婆把他赶了出来。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He was kicked out of the golf club.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他被逐出了高尔夫球俱乐部。

Sense.DEF: a movement of your foot or leg, usually to hit something with your foot
Sense.EXAMPLE: Brazil scored with the last kick of the match.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 巴西队在全场比赛的最后一次射门进球了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Rory aimed a kick at her leg and missed.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 罗里对准她的腿踢去﹐但没有踢到。
Sense.EXAMPLE: kung fu kicks
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 中国功夫的踢腿
Sense.EXAMPLE: If the door won’t open, just give it a good kick.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果门打不开的话﹐就使劲踢一脚。

Sense.DEF: the act of kicking the ball in a sports game such as football, or the ball that is kicked and the direction it goes in
Sense.EXAMPLE: Benjamin struck a post with an overhead kick.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 本杰明一个倒钩球踢在门柱上。

GramExa.GLOSS: allowed by the rules, for a player in one team to kick the ball without being stopped by the other team
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Pearce came forward to takethe free kick.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 皮尔斯上前踢任意球。

Sense.DEF: something that you enjoy because it is exciting

GramExa.PROPFORM: get a kick out of/from (doing) sth
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Gerald gets a kick out of dressing as a woman.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 杰拉尔德觉得男扮女装很刺激。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: It gives her a kick to get you into trouble.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 给你惹出麻烦她就开心。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She used to steal from shops for kicks.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她以前经常从商店偷东西来寻求刺激。

Sense.LEXUNIT: a kick up the arse/backside/pants etc
Sense.DEF: informal criticism or strong encouragement to make someone do something they should have done
Sense.EXAMPLE: What Phil needs is a good kick up the arse.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 得好好教训一下菲尔。

Sense.DEF: something that is very disappointing or upsetting that happens when you need support
Sense.TRAN: 〔需要支持时〕极度的失望[苦恼]
Sense.EXAMPLE: This broken promise is a real kick in the teeth for our fans.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这次食言真让我们的支持者极其失望。

Sense.DEF: used to talk about the strong effect of a drink or drug or the strong taste that some food has
Sense.TRAN: 〔酒﹑毒品﹑某些食物等的〕劲﹐刺激性﹐浓烈
Sense.EXAMPLE: The wine had a real kick.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这酒很有劲。

Sense.DEF: strong, powerful, and sometimes violent
Sense.EXAMPLE: a kick-ass attitude
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 粗暴的态度

Sense.DEF: money that some­one pays secretly and dishonestly in return for someone’s help
an American game for children, similar to baseball, in which you kick the ball
Sense.TRAN: 〔源于美国﹐类似棒球的〕儿童足球游戏

Sense.DEF: a form of boxing in which you kick someone as well as hitting them
a player in a sports team who kicks the ball to score points
a surprising or important ending to something
Sense.EXAMPLE: The kicker came when the reporter asked the runner whether she was tired.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 当记者问那位赛跑选手是否疲惫时﹐出人意料的事情发生了。

Sense.DEF: women’s trousers that become wider below the knee
another word for a heelflip
the time when a football game starts, or the first kick of the game
Sense.EXAMPLE: Kickoff is at 3.00.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 足球比赛3点开始。

Sense.DEF: the beginning of a new activity
a thin piece of metal on the bottom of a bicycle or motorcycle that supports it in an upright position when it is not moving
to do something to help a process or activity start or develop more quickly
Sense.EXAMPLE: He urged further interest rate cuts in a bid to kick-start the economy.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他极力主张进一步降低利率以推动经济。

Sense.DEF: to start a motorcycle using your foot
the part of a motorcycle that you press with your foot to start it
action taken to make a plan, project etc start or develop more quickly
Sense.EXAMPLE: Motivation is the kick-start you need to succeed at work.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 积极主动是在工作中成功的捷径。

Sense.DEF: a child
Sense.EXAMPLE: She’d always loved animals since she was a little kid.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她从小就喜爱动物。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He’s married with three kids.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他已婚﹐有三个孩子。
Sense.EXAMPLE: A neighbor volunteered to keep an eye on the kids their children or the children they are responsible for.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一位邻居主动来照看这些小孩。

F2NBox.HEADING: REGISTER 语体
F2NBox.EXPL: Kidis informal. For formal or written styles usechild.
F2NBox.TRAN: kid是非正式用语﹐正式用语或书面语中用child
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: Research suggests that children from abusive families are likely to repeat violent behaviour.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 研究表明﹐来自暴力家庭的孩子可能也会有暴力行为。

Sense.DEF: a young person
Sense.EXAMPLE: college kids
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 大学生

Sense.DEF: used by adults to address a person who is younger than them
Sense.TRAN: 年轻人〔成年人用以称呼比自己小的人〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Hey kid, come here.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 喂﹐年轻人﹐到这儿来。

Sense.DEF: something that is too easy or boring
Sense.TRAN: 轻而易举的事情﹔单调乏味的事
Sense.EXAMPLE: Pokémon? Oh boy, that is kid stuff!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 《宠物小精灵》？得了吧﹐小孩子看的玩意儿！

Subsense.DEF: a young goat
very soft leather made from the skin of a young goat
Subsense.EXAMPLE: a pair of white kid boots
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一双白色的小山羊皮靴

Sense.DEF: a way of treating someone kindly and carefully because they easily become upset

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I want you to treat Hayley with kid gloves today. She’s still upset about her father.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我希望你今天对海莉态度小心些﹐她还在为她父亲的事心烦。

Sense.DEF: to say something that is not true, especially as a joke

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Don’t get mad – I was only kidding.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 别生气﹐我只不过是开玩笑。

Sense.DEF: to make jokes or say funny things about someone in a friendly way

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We were kidding Mom about being a grandmother.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们逗妈妈说她要当祖母了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: My friends kidded me that my gear would fill the car.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 朋友们取笑我﹐说我的东西要把车子塞满了。

Sense.DEF: used when you are so surprised by what someone has told you that you do not completely believe them
Sense.EXAMPLE: Carlotta’s 39? No kidding?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 卡洛塔39岁了？不是开玩笑吧？

Subsense.DEF: used to say that you understand and agree with what someone has just said
Subsense.TRAN: 没错﹐可不是〔表示理解或同意别人的话〕
Subsense.EXAMPLE: ‘That girl has some major problems’ ‘Yeah, no kidding’
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: “那女孩有些严重的问题。”“对﹐没错。

Subsense.DEF: used to emphasize a threat or that you are telling the truth
Subsense.EXAMPLE: If you break that thing, you’ll be grounded for a week – no kidding.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 要是你把那东西打破了﹐就罚你一星期不许出门——绝不是开玩笑的。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: And then he saw us and – no kidding – he asked us if we wanted a ride.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 然后他就看到我们了﹐还问我们要不要搭便车﹐不骗你。

Sense.DEF: to let yourself believe something that is untrue or unlikely

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Don’t kid yourself he’ll ever change.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你别自欺欺人地以为他会改变。

Sense.EXAMPLE: We thought we could change the world. Just who were we trying to kid?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们自以为能够改变世界﹐我们这是在骗谁呢？

Sense.DEF: used to emphasize that you are telling the truth
Sense.TRAN: 跟你说正经的﹐我不骗你

Sense.DEF: to behave in a silly way
Sense.EXAMPLE: Stop kidding around and listen.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 别胡闹了﹐听我说。

Sense.DEF: your kid sister or brother is younger than you are
a young child
Sense.EXAMPLE: a sandpit for the kiddies
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 给小朋友玩的沙坑

Sense.DEF: made for, involving, or intended for young children
Sense.EXAMPLE: a kiddie seat
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 儿童座位

Sense.DEF: a camera that allows parents to see their children when the parents are somewhere else
Sense.TRAN: 〔家长观察孩子情况的〕儿童监视器

Sense.DEF: used by adults to address a young person
Sense.TRAN: 年轻人﹐小伙子〔成年人对年轻人的一种称呼〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Come on kiddo, let’s go.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 来﹐小伙子﹐我们走吧。

Sense.DEF: to take someone somewhere illegally by force, often in order to get money for returning them
Sense.EXAMPLE: Police appealed for wit­nesses after a woman was kidnapped at gunpoint.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一名妇女遭到持枪绑架﹐警方呼吁目击者挺身而出。

Sense.DEF: one of the two organs in your lower back that separate waste products from your blood and make urine
Sense.EXAMPLE: a kidney transplant
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 肾脏移植

Sense.DEF: one or more of these organs from an animal, used as food
Sense.TRAN: 腰子〔指供食用的动物肾脏〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: steak and kidney pie
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 牛肉腰子馅饼

Sense.DEF: a dark red bean that is shaped like the letter C
an adult who likes to play games or buy things that most people consider more suitable for children
Sense.TRAN: 童心未泯的成人〔指喜爱儿童游戏或购买儿童物品的成年人〕

Sense.DEF: a very offensive word for someone who is Jewish. Do not use this word.
Sense.TRAN: 犹太佬﹐犹太鬼子〔勿用此词〕

Sense.DEF: to make a person or animal die
Sense.EXAMPLE: Why did she kill her husband?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她为什么杀死丈夫？
Sense.EXAMPLE: Murray held a gun to his head and threatened to kill him.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 默里拿枪指着他的头并威胁要杀了他。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Four people were killed when a train plunged into a flooded river.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 火车冲进洪水泛滥的河中﹐造成四人身亡。

GramExa.GLOSS: immediately
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The driver was killed instantly.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 司机当场死亡。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Bleach kills household germs.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 漂白剂能够杀灭日常病菌。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Smoking kills.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 吸烟会致人死亡。

Subsense.DEF: to cause your own death
Subsense.EXAMPLE: You’re going to kill yourself on that bike.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你骑那辆自行车会送命的。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: After her husband died, Mary tried to kill herself.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 丈夫去世后﹐玛丽曾试图自杀。

Subsense.DEF: to work very hard to achieve something, in a way that makes you ill or tired
Subsense.EXAMPLE: It’s not worth killing yourself over it.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 为了它累坏身体不值得。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He about killed himself to make the business go.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 为了维持生意﹐他几乎把身体累垮了。

Sense.DEF: to make something stop operating or fail
Sense.EXAMPLE: Joe pulled in and killed the engine.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 乔把车靠到路边停下﹐关闭了引擎。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The out-of-town shopping centre will kill local trade.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 城外的购物中心将令本地商业难以为继。

GramExa.GLOSS: drive slowly

Sense.DEF: to be very angry with someone
Sense.EXAMPLE: Mom will kill me if I’m late.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我要是晚了﹐妈妈会大发脾气的。

Sense.DEF: to make someone feel annoyed, sad, concerned etc

GramExa.PROPFORM: it kills sb to do sth
GramExa.EXAMPLE: It kills me to see him working so hard.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 看到他这么拼命工作﹐我担心得要命。

Sense.EXAMPLE: What happened next? The suspense is killing me.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 接下来发生了什么？这一悬念真是要了我的命。

Sense.DEF: to want something so much that you will do almost anything to get it or do it
Sense.TRAN: 愿不惜一切得到某物﹐极想要某物
Sense.EXAMPLE: I could kill for a smoke right now.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 现在我非常想吸口烟。
Sense.EXAMPLE: In those days, actors would kill to break into film.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那时候﹐演员都拼命想挤入电影界。

Sense.LEXUNIT: my head/back etc is killing me
Sense.DEF: used to say that a part of your body is hurting a lot
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ve walked miles and my feet are killing me.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我走了很远的路﹐脚痛得要命。

Sense.DEF: to spend time doing something which is not important, while you are waiting to do something important or waiting for something else to happen
Sense.EXAMPLE: With time to kill, he took a cab to the centre.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 还有点时间可以消磨﹐于是他叫了一辆出租车去市中心。

Sense.LEXUNIT: kill a beer/bottle of wine etc
Sense.DEF: to drink or finish drinking a beer etc quickly
Sense.TRAN: 一口喝下啤酒/一瓶葡萄酒等
Sense.EXAMPLE: Let’s kill these beers and go.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们一口干了啤酒就走吧。

Sense.DEF: to make someone laugh a lot

GramExa.EXAMPLE: They weren’t bothered – in fact, they were killing themselves laughing.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们并不在意﹐事实上他们简直笑破了肚皮。

Sense.LEXUNIT: it won’t/wouldn’t kill sb (to do something)
Sense.DEF: used to say that someone could easily do something, and ought to do it
Sense.TRAN: (做某事)又不会要了某人的命〔因此应该去做〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: It wouldn’t kill you to help out once in a while.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 偶尔帮别人一把又不会要了你的命。

Sense.DEF: used to emphasize that you are determined to do something, even though it is very difficult
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’m completing this course, even if it kills me.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 哪怕再难﹐我也要完成这门课程。

Sense.LEXUNIT: kill two birds with one stone
Sense.DEF: to achieve two things with one action
Sense.TRAN: 一石二鸟﹐一举两得﹐一箭双雕

Sense.LEXUNIT: kill the goose that lays the golden egg
Sense.DEF: to destroy the thing that brings you profit or success
to welcome someone home with a big meal etc after they have been away for a long time
Sense.TRAN: 盛宴款待〔长期离家归来的人〕

Sense.DEF: to be too kind to someone, in a way that actually harms them
used to say that something you are going to do will be either successful or fail completely
Sense.TRAN: 不是一举成功﹐就是一败涂地﹔成败在此一举

Exponent.DEF: to make someone die
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The driver and his passenger were killed in the crash.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 司机和乘客都在车祸中丧命了。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He was killed by rival gang members.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他被敌对帮派成员杀死了。

Exponent.DEF: to deliberately kill someone - used when talking about this as a crime
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He was convicted of murdering his wife.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他被判杀妻罪。

Exponent.DEF: to kill someone without intending to - used when talking about this as a crime
Exponent.TRAN: 犯过失杀人罪，犯误杀罪
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The court ruled that the guard had committed manslaughter.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 法院裁定警卫过失杀人。

Exponent.DEF: to deliberately kill an important person, especially a politician
Exponent.TRAN: 暗杀，行刺〔重要人物，尤指政治人物〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He was part of plot to assassinate Hilter.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他参与了暗杀希特勒的密谋。

Exponent.DEF: to kill someone or something in a violent way - used in newspaper reports and also in old stories
Exponent.TRAN: 残害，残杀〔用于新闻报道或故事传说〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Two teenagers were slain in the shootings.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 两名少年在枪击中遇害。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: St. George slew the dragon.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 圣乔治杀死了那条龙。

Exponent.DEF: to kill someone as a punishment for a crime
Exponent.EXAMPLE: McVeigh, who killed 168 people in a bombing attack, was executed by lethal injection.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 制造炸弹袭击导致168人死亡的麦克维被处以注射死刑。

Exponent.DEF: to kill someone in order to prevent them from causing trouble
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a ruthless dictator who eliminated all his rivals
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 除掉所有敌对者的残酷独裁者

Exponent.DEF: to kill someone in order to get rid of them, especially an enemy or someone who is causing trouble for you
Exponent.EXAMPLE: US forces used air strikes to take out the enemy positions.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 美军采用空袭来端掉敌军据点。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: One of the other drug dealers may have decided to take him out.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 可能是其他毒贩中有人决定干掉他。

Exponent.DEF: to kill someone
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He was so irritating I felt like bumping him off myself.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他太讨厌了，我真想亲手把他解决掉。

Exponent.DEF: to kill yourself
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He committed suicide after the death of his girlfriend.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 女朋友死后他自杀了。

Exponent.DEF: to kill oneself
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He had taken his own life while he was severely depressed.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他因极度消沉而自杀了。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: They believe that it is a sin to take your own life.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们认为自杀是一种罪过。

Section.SECHEADING: to kill a large number of people

Exponent.DEF: to kill a large number of people in a violent way
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Thousands of peaceful demonstrators were massacred by the soldiers.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 成千上万名和平示威者遭士兵屠杀。

Exponent.DEF: to kill a large number of people in a violent way. Slaughteris also used about killing animals for food.
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The army slaughtered thousands of civilians in an effort to stop the revolt.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 军队为镇压暴乱而屠杀了成千上万的平民。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The pigs were slaughtered on the farm.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些猪在养猪场被屠宰。

Exponent.DEF: to kill large numbers of a particular group, so that they no longer exist
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Hitler's goal was to exterminate the Jews.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 希特勒的目标是消灭犹太人。

Sense.DEF: to cause the death of a lot of living things
Sense.TRAN: 使〔生物〕大量死亡﹔使灭绝
Sense.EXAMPLE: Pollution is rapidly killing off plant life.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 污染导致大量植物迅速死亡。

Sense.DEF: to stop or remove something completely
Sense.TRAN: 使〔某事〕彻底停止﹔根除〔某物〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: These figures kill off any hope that the economy is poised for recovery.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些数据彻底粉碎了经济复苏的希望。

Sense.DEF: the act of killing a hunted animal
Sense.EXAMPLE: He raised his knife for the kill.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他举起刀子准备宰杀。

Sense.LEXUNIT: move in/close in for the kill
Sense.DEF: to come closer to something in order to kill, defeat, or destroy it
Sense.TRAN: 逐渐靠近以伺机杀死[击败﹐摧毁]
Sense.EXAMPLE: Enemy submarines were moving in for the kill.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 敌人的潜艇正靠近目标准备攻击。

Sense.DEF: an animal that is killed by another animal
Sense.EXAMPLE: The cubs will share the remains of the kill.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 幼兽将分享猎物被吃剩的部分。

Sense.DEF: a person, animal, or thing that kills
Sense.TRAN: 杀手﹔导致死亡的人[动物﹐事物]
Sense.EXAMPLE: Heart disease is America’s number one killer.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 心脏病是美国人的头号杀手。
Sense.EXAMPLE: the hunt for her killers
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对杀害她的凶手的追捕
Sense.EXAMPLE: weed killer
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 除草剂

Sense.DEF: something or someone that is very difficult, tiring, or boring
Sense.TRAN: 棘手的事［人］﹔极累人的事﹔极无聊的事［人］
Sense.EXAMPLE: The new project is a killer.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个新项目非常棘手。

Sense.DEF: something that is very exciting or impressive
Sense.TRAN: 令人激动的事物﹔极其精彩的事物
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’m not saying the film is a killer, but it’s cool.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这部影片说不上极其精彩﹐但还是很棒。

Sense.DEF: very harmful or dangerous
Sense.TRAN: 危害极大的﹔极其危险的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a killer hurricane
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一场危害极大的飓风
Sense.EXAMPLE: a swarm of killer bees
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一大群杀人蜂

Sense.DEF: very attractive, good, impressive etc
Sense.TRAN: 极吸引人的﹔极其精彩的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a book called ‘How to Build a Killer Website’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一本名为《如何创建精彩网站》的书

Sense.DEF: a very strong desire to succeed in a situation or activity etc that is very competitive
Sense.TRAN: 拼杀的本能﹐争胜的拼劲
Sense.EXAMPLE: Young players these days lack the killer instinct.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如今的年轻选手缺乏拼杀的本能。

Sense.DEF: a piece of technology on a new product, which is so good or useful that a lot of people buy the product
Sense.TRAN: 〔新产品的〕制胜法宝﹐卖点技术

Sense.DEF: a black and white whale that eats meat
the act of killing someone deliberately
Sense.EXAMPLE: a series of gangland killings
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一连串黑帮凶杀案
Sense.EXAMPLE: They murdered fifteen boys in a killing spree an occasion when someone murders many people in a short period of time across southern California.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们在加利福尼亚南部各地一时间杀害了15名男孩。

Sense.DEF: to make a lot of money in a short time
Sense.EXAMPLE: He made a killing on the stock exchange.

Sense.DEF: someone who spoils other people’s pleasure
a special oven for baking clay pots, bricks etc
a kilogram
a thousand – used with units of measurement
a unit for measuring computer information, equal to 1,024 bytes
Sense.TRAN: 千字节〔计算机存储量单位﹐等于1,024个字节〕

Sense.DEF: a unit for measuring weight, equal to 1,000 grams
Sense.TRAN: 千克﹐公斤〔重量单位﹐等于1,000克〕

Sense.DEF: a unit for measuring the frequency of sound waves especially radio signals, equal to 1,000 hertz
a unit for measuring distance, equal to 1,000 metres
a unit for measuring electrical power, equal to 1,000 watts
a unit for measuring electrical power, equal to the amount of work produced by one kilowatt in one hour
a type of thick skirt made of tartan material with a pattern of lines and squares that is traditionally worn by Scottish men
Sense.TRAN: 褶裥短裙〔苏格兰男子的传统服饰〕

PIC.HEADING: KILT 褶裥短裙
PIC.PICCONTENT: bagpipes 风笛；kilt 褶裥短裙

Sense.DEF: not working as well as usual
Sense.EXAMPLE: Pollution has thrown the Earth’s chemistry out of kilter.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 污染使得地球的化学组成失调。

Sense.DEF: a Korean hot-tasting dish made of pickled cabbage and other vegetables
a traditional piece of Japanese clothing like a long loose coat, worn at special ceremonies
your family
your most closely related family
Sense.EXAMPLE: We’ll have to notify the next of kin of his death.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们得把他去世的消息通知他的直系亲属。

Sense.DEF: one of the different types of a person or thing that belong to the same group

GramExa.EXAMPLE: They sell all kinds of things.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们出售各种各样的东西。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The flowers attract several different kinds of insects.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些花吸引几种不同的昆虫。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Greg was working on some kind of deal in Italy.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 格雷格正在意大利做某种生意。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Get me a sandwich – any kind will do.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 给我一份三明治﹐随便哪种都可以。

Sense.DEF: used to describe a person with a particular character, feelings, opinions etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: Ted just isn’t the marrying kind.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 特德就不是想结婚的那种人。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Rob isn’t the kind to worry.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 罗布不是会发愁的那种人。

Sense.DEF: the type of person, thing, place etc that someone usually likes
Sense.TRAN: 某人通常喜欢的人/物/地方等
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s not my kind of place – it’s too quiet.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这不是我喜欢的地方——太安静了。

Sense.DEF: slightly but not exactly, or in some ways
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’m kind of glad I didn’t win.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我倒是有点高兴我没有赢。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He’s kinda dumb, isn’t he?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他有点傻﹐是不是？

Sense.DEF: used to say that your description of something is not exact
Sense.EXAMPLE: a kind of reddish-brown color
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 近似红棕色

Sense.DEF: two, three etc people or things that are very similar
Sense.TRAN: 属于同一类的两/三个人[事物]等
Sense.EXAMPLE: You and Joe are two of a kind.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你和乔是同一类人。

Sense.DEF: the only one of a particular type of thing
Sense.EXAMPLE: Each plate is handpainted and one of a kind.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 每个盘子都由手工绘制﹐是独一无二的。

Sense.DEF: something similar to what was expected or talked about
Sense.TRAN: 类似的事情﹐差不多的东西
Sense.EXAMPLE: Rosa was shocked by the news, although she had suspected something of the kind might happen.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 罗莎虽然怀疑可能会发生那种事情﹐但听到这消息还是感到震惊。

Sense.DEF: used to emphasize that what has been said is not true
Sense.EXAMPLE: I never said anything of the kind!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我从来没说过那种话！

Sense.DEF: used to say that something is not as good as it should be
Sense.EXAMPLE: Elections of a kind are held, but there is only one party to vote for.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 虽然举行了所谓的选举﹐但只有一个政党可选。

Sense.DEF: reacting to something someone has done by doing the same thing
Sense.TRAN: 以同样的方法﹐以相同的手段
Sense.EXAMPLE: After recent bombings, counter-terrorist forces could retaliate in kind.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 最近的爆炸案发生过后﹐反恐部队可能会以牙还牙。

Sense.DEF: saying or doing things that show that you care about other people and want to help them or make them happy

GramExa.EXAMPLE: They’ve been very kind to me.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们对我很好。

Sense.EXAMPLE: It wasn’t a very kind thing to say.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这么说可不太客气。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She’s a very kind and generous person.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她是个很和蔼大方的人。

GramExa.PROPFORM: it’s kind of sb (to do sth)
GramExa.EXAMPLE: It’s kind of you to say that.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 感谢你这么说。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: It’s really kind of them to let us use their pool.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们真好﹐借泳池给我们用。

Sense.EXAMPLE: We thanked the priest for his kind words.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们对牧师亲切的话语表示感谢。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Thank you for your help. You’ve been most kind said when thanking someone very politely.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 谢谢您的帮助﹐您真是太好了。

GramExa.PROPFORM: thank you for your kind invitation/offer
GramExa.GLOSS: said when thanking someone very politely for their invitation or offer
GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 感谢您的盛情邀请/好意

Sense.EXAMPLE: Ms Jarvis is unable to accept your kind invitation.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 贾维斯女士无法接受您的盛情邀请。

Sense.DEF: not causing harm or suffering

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Life has been very kind to me.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 生活一向待我不薄。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: I need a soap that’s kinder to my skin.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我需要一种对皮肤较为温和的肥皂。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Let’s hope the weather’s kind tomorrow.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 但愿明天天气好吧。

Sense.LEXUNIT: would you be kind enough to do sth/be so kind as to do sth
Sense.DEF: used to make a polite request
Sense.TRAN: 劳驾…﹐劳烦您做某事好吗
Sense.EXAMPLE: Would you be kind enough to close the door, please?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 劳烦关上门好吗？

F2NBox.HEADING: REGISTER 语体
F2NBox.EXPL: In everyday English, people usually say please could you ...? or would you mind ...? because the expressions with kind can sound too formal and unfriendly.
F2NBox.TRAN: 在日常英语中﹐人们通常说 please could you ...? 或 would you mind ...?﹐因为含 kind 的表达方式显得过于正式及不友好
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: Would you mind closing the door?

Sense.DEF: written used to end a formal but fairly friendly letter
Sense.TRAN: 谨致问候〔用于正式但相当友好的书信结尾〕

Exponent.DEF: someone who is kind tries to help people and make them happy or comfortable, and shows that they care about them
Exponent.EXAMPLE: They were very kind to us and let us stay in their house as long as we liked.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们对我们很友好﹐让我们在他们家随便住多久。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a kind old lady
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 一位和善的老太太
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a kind thing to say
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 善意的话

Exponent.DEF: friendly and kind – very common in everyday spoken English and often used instead of kind
Exponent.TRAN: 友好的﹐友善的〔日常英语口语中常用 nice﹐而不用 kind〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Everyone has been so nice to me.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 大家都对我很友好。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: It’s nice of you to invite me here.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 你请我来这里真是客气。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He seems such a nice man.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他看上去真是个好人。

Exponent.DEF: kind because you give people money, presents etc
Exponent.EXAMPLE: ‘I’ll pay for the meal.’ ‘That’s very generous of you.’
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: “我来付饭钱。”“你真慷慨。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a generous gift
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 丰厚的礼品

Exponent.DEF: thinking about other people’s feelings, and careful not to do anything that will upset them
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Our neighbours are very considerate and always keep their TV turned down.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们的邻居很体谅人﹐总是把电视机音量调低。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a considerate driver
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 为人着想的司机

Exponent.DEF: thinking of things you can do to make other people happy or feel good – used especially when someone does something such as giving someone a present or helping someone
Exponent.EXAMPLE: It was thoughtful of you to send him a card.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 你寄贺卡给他﹐真是心思周到。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Some thoughtful person had taken her bag to the lost property office.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 有位好心人把她的包送到了失物招领处。

Exponent.DEF: kind and wanting to help and look after people
Exponent.TRAN: 乐于助人的﹐关心他人的
Exponent.EXAMPLE: She’s lucky to have such a loving and caring husband.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 她有个这么爱她关心她的丈夫真是幸运。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The British are well-known for their caring attitude toward animals.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 英国人以关爱动物见称。

Exponent.DEF: saying kind things to someone who has problems and behaving in a way that shows you care about them
Exponent.EXAMPLE: My boss was very sympathetic and said I should take some time off work.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 老板很同情我﹐说我应该休息一下。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: She gave him a sympathetic smile.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 她对他同情地一笑。

Exponent.DEF: kind and showing that you want to help – used especially in the following phrases
Exponent.TRAN: 善意的﹐乐于助人的〔尤用于以下短语〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: It was good of you to come and see me.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 你来看我真是太好了。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: She’s always been very good to us.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 她一直对我们很好。

Exponent.DEF: very kind – used especially when you like someone very much, or you are very pleased because of something they have done
Exponent.TRAN: 好心的﹐善良的〔尤用于表示非常喜欢某人或对某人做的事很称心〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I was given the flowers by a sweet little old lady who lived next door.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 这花是隔壁一位善良的小老太太送我的。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: It’s sweet of you to ask.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 你来问真是好心。

Exponent.DEF: especially written having a kind and friendly character, which makes other people like you
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He was a wonderful father, kind-hearted and always laughing.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他是个好父亲﹐心地善良﹐总是笑呵呵的。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The town is full of warm-hearted, helpful people.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 这镇上的居民都是乐于助人的热心肠。

Exponent.DEF: kind and wanting to help people – often used about someone who is important or who people respect
Exponent.TRAN: 仁慈的﹐乐善好施的〔常用于重要或德高望重的人物〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a benevolent ruler
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 一位仁慈的统治者
Exponent.EXAMPLE: They believe in the existence of a benevolent God who will save mankind.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们相信会有一位仁慈的上帝来拯救人类。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He listened politely, like some benevolent uncle.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他彬彬有礼地听着﹐仿佛一位慈祥的叔叔。

Sense.DEF: a school or class for children aged five
a school for children aged two to five
Sense.TRAN: 〔为两岁至五岁儿童开办的〕幼儿园

Sense.DEF: kind and generous
Sense.EXAMPLE: a kind-hearted gesture
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 仁慈的表示

Sense.DEF: if you kindle a fire, or if it kindles, it starts to burn
to make someone feel interested, excited, hopeful etc

GramExa.EXAMPLE: A love of poetry was kindled in him by his mother.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的母亲激发了他对诗歌的兴趣。

Sense.DEF: small sticks, leaves etc that you use to start a fire
in a kind way

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Mr Nunn has kindly agreed to let us use his barn for the dance.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 纳恩先生慷慨地允许我们借用他的谷仓举行舞会。

Sense.DEF: to be unwilling to accept a situation because it annoys you
Sense.EXAMPLE: She does not take kindly to criticism.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她不乐意接受批评。

Sense.DEF: to approve of someone or something
Sense.TRAN: 赞成某人／某事﹐同意某人／某事
Sense.EXAMPLE: Jimmy would probably not look too kindly on our request.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 吉米可能不会同意我们的请求。

Sense.DEF: a word meaning ‘please’, which is often used when you are annoyed
Sense.EXAMPLE: Will you kindly put that book back?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 请你把那本书放回去好不好？

Sense.DEF: kind and caring for other people
Sense.TRAN: 友善的﹔亲切的﹔和蔼的﹔体贴的
Sense.EXAMPLE: Mrs Gardiner was a kindly old soul.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 加德纳夫人是位和蔼可亲的老人。

Sense.DEF: kind behaviour towards someone
Sense.EXAMPLE: I can’t thank you enough for your kindness.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你的好意我感激不尽。

F2NBox.HEADING: REGISTER 语体
F2NBox.EXPL: In everyday English, when you are thanking people for helping you, the normal phrase to use is Thanks for (all) your help . The phrase Thank you for your kindness sounds very polite and slightly old-fashioned.
F2NBox.TRAN: 在日常英语中﹐感谢别人帮助时常用短语 Thanks for (all) your help 。 而 Thank you for your kindness 听起来十分客套﹐且有点过时 。

Sense.DEF: a kind action

GramExa.EXAMPLE: It would be doing him a kindness to tell him the truth.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 把真相告诉他对他有好处。

Sense.DEF: your whole family
someone who thinks and feels the way you do
belonging to the same group or family
Sense.TRAN: 同宗的，同类的﹔同源的﹔类似的
Sense.EXAMPLE: The protest included members of Free the Streets and kindred organisations.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 参加此次抗议的包括“解放街头”组织以及类似团体的成员。

Sense.DEF: relating to movement
Sense.EXAMPLE: kinetic energy
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 动能

Sense.DEF: the science that studies movement
a man who rules a country because he is from a royal family

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Henry VIII, King of England
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 英格兰国王亨利八世

Sense.EXAMPLE: On 2 December Henry VI was crowned king made the king at an official ceremony.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 12月2日﹐亨利六世加冕为王。

Sense.DEF: someone or something that people think is the most important or best of a particular type of person or thing
Sense.TRAN: 某物之王﹔某物中的极品
Sense.EXAMPLE: the King of Rock ’n’ Roll
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 摇滚乐之王
Sense.EXAMPLE: the king of Swiss cheeses
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 瑞士奶酪中的极品
Sense.EXAMPLE: The lion is the king of the jungle.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 狮子是丛林之王。

Sense.DEF: if you live like a king, feel like a king etc, you are very successful, happy, rich etc
Sense.TRAN: 极佳的感觉 〔指极其成功﹑幸福﹑富有等〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: With her at my side, I felt like a king.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有她在我身边﹐我感到非常幸福。

Sense.DEF: the most important piece in chess
a playing card with a picture of a king on it
if something is king at a particular time, it has a big influence on people
Sense.EXAMPLE: back in the days when jazz was king
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在往昔爵士乐极为盛行的年代

Sense.DEF: a very large amount of money
a country ruled by a king or queen
Sense.EXAMPLE: the United Kingdom
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 联合王国

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the kingdom of Thailand
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 泰王国

Sense.DEF: one of the three parts into which the natural world is divided
Sense.TRAN: 动物界/植物界/矿物界〔大自然三界〕

Sense.DEF: heaven
a phrase used to describe the end of the world, death, or the end of time
Sense.EXAMPLE: He left the gas on and nearly blew us all to kingdom come.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他忘了关上煤气﹐差点把我们都送上西天。
