a small object used as a decoration
Sense.EXAMPLE: They had various knick-knacks on the top of the bookcase.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们的书柜顶上放有各种小摆设。

Sense.DEF: a metal blade fixed into a handle, used for cutting or as a weapon
Sense.EXAMPLE: a knife and fork
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一副刀叉
Sense.EXAMPLE: Some young people are carrying knives to defend themselves.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一些年轻人带着刀子防身。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a kitchen knife
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 厨房用刀
Sense.EXAMPLE: Use a sharp knife to cut the melon into sections.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 用快刀把瓜切成块。

PIC.HEADING: KNIVES 刀
PIC.PICCONTENT: carving knife 切肉刀；kitchen knife 厨用刀；palette knife 调色刀；craft knife BrE【英】/X-Acto knife AmE【美】美工刀；sheath 刀鞘；sheath knife 鞘刀；blade 刀刃；handle 刀把；flick knife BrE【英】/switchblade AmE【美】弹簧刀；penknife 折叠刀；scalpel 手术刀；paper knife BrE【英】拆信刀

Sense.DEF: used to say that people are being extremely unfriendly in criticizing someone
Sense.EXAMPLE: The knives are out for the vice president.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 要对副总统兴师问罪了。

Sense.DEF: to say something that makes someone more upset about a subject they are already unhappy about

Sense.LEXUNIT: stick/put etc the knife in/into someone
Sense.DEF: to dislike someone and be very unfriendly towards them
Sense.TRAN: 对某人怀恨在心﹐对某人极不友好

Sense.DEF: having a medical operation

Sense.LEXUNIT: you could cut the atmosphere/air/tension with a knife
Sense.DEF: used to say that you felt the people in a room were angry with each other
Sense.TRAN: 〔感觉到屋内的人相互间〕气氛很不友好﹐使人透不过气来

Sense.DEF: used to say that something happens or is done very easily, without any problems
to put a knife into someone’s body
Sense.EXAMPLE: She had been knifed to death.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她被人用刀刺死了。

Sense.DEF: a situation in which the result is extremely uncertain
Sense.TRAN: 胜负难料的形势﹐结果未定的情况

GramExa.EXAMPLE: His future in the job is balanced on a knife-edge.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的这份工作前途难料。

Sense.EXAMPLE: a knife-edge vote
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 胜负难料的选举

Sense.DEF: a situation which makes someone very anxious

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Living with him, she is constantly on a knife-edge.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 和他生活在一起她总是很紧张。

Sense.EXAMPLE: the knife-edge of insecurity
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 缺乏安全感引起的焦虑

Sense.DEF: something that is narrow or sharp
using a knife to threaten someone
Sense.EXAMPLE: An eighty-year-old man was robbed at knifepoint in his home.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一名80岁老翁在自己家中遭持刀抢劫。

Sense.DEF: a man with a high rank in the past who was trained to fight while riding a horse
Sense.EXAMPLE: knights in armour
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 身披盔甲的骑士

Sense.DEF: a man who has received a knighthood and has the title ‘sir’ before his name
Sense.TRAN: 爵士〔名前冠有Sir这一头衔〕

Sense.DEF: the chess piece with a horse’s head on it
a brave man who saves someone, especially a woman, from a dangerous situation
Sense.TRAN: 救人〔尤为女性〕于危难之中的勇士

Sense.DEF: to give someone the rank of knight
a knight in the past who travelled looking for adventure
a British rank and title that are given to a man as an honour for achievement or for doing good things
relating to knights or typical of a knight, especially behaving with courage and honour
Sense.TRAN: 骑士的﹔侠义的﹐勇敢而高尚的
Sense.EXAMPLE: knightly deeds of chivalry
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 充满骑士精神的侠义行为

Sense.DEF: to make clothing out of wool, using two knitting needles
Sense.EXAMPLE: My grandmother taught me how to knit.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我祖母教过我编织。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She’s knitting a sweater.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她在织毛衣。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Emily knitted him some socks.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 埃米莉给他织了几双短袜。

Sense.DEF: to use a plain basic knitting stitch
Sense.EXAMPLE: Knit one, purl one.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一针平针﹐一针反针。

Sense.DEF: to join people, things, or ideas more closely together, or to be joined closely together

GramExa.EXAMPLE: In a good report, individual sentences knit together in a clear way that readers can follow.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一份好的报告中﹐各个句子之间衔接紧密﹑思路清晰﹐读者很容易读懂。

GramExa.GLOSS: with all the members having close relationships
GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 紧密团结的﹐紧密结合的
GramExa.EXAMPLE: a closely knit community
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 紧密团结的社区
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Harold is part of a tightly knit team.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 哈罗德是一个紧密团结的小组中的一员。

Sense.DEF: a bone that knits after being broken grows into one piece again

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The pin holds the bones in place while they knit together.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 钢钉固定着骨头促使其愈合。

Sense.DEF: to show you are worried, thinking hard etc by moving your eyebrows together
Sense.TRAN: 紧锁眉头〔表示忧虑﹑思索等〕

Sense.DEF: something that is being knitted
the activity or action of knitting clothes
one of the two long sticks with round ends that you use to knit something
knitted clothing
Sense.EXAMPLE: a knitwear shop
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 针织品商店

Sense.DEF: the plural of knife1
a round handle or thing that you turn to open a door, turn on a television etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: He thought the door was locked, but he turned the knob and the door opened.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他本以为门是锁住的﹐但是转了一下把手门就开了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a brass door knob
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 黄铜门把手
Sense.EXAMPLE: I adjusted the volume knob and sat down.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我调节好音量旋钮﹐坐了下来。

Sense.DEF: a small piece of something
Sense.EXAMPLE: Melt a knob of butter in the pan.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 将一小块黄油放在平底锅中熔化。

Sense.DEF: a penis
used especially by children to reply to an insult
Sense.TRAN: 更是那样〔尤为小孩反唇相讥时的用语〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘You’re fat and lazy.’ ‘Fat and lazy to you with brass knobs on!’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “你又胖又懒。”“你才又胖又懒呢！ ”

Sense.DEF: with hard parts that stick out from under the surface of something
Sense.EXAMPLE: knobbly knees
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 突出的膝关节

Sense.DEF: to hit a door or window with your closed hand to attract the attention of the people inside
Sense.EXAMPLE: I knocked and knocked but nobody answered.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我把门敲了又敲﹐但无人回应。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We knocked at the door but there was no one there.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们敲了门﹐但里面没人。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Wilson went up and knocked on the door.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 威尔逊走上前去敲门。

Sense.DEF: to hit something with a short quick action so that it moves or falls

GramExa.EXAMPLE: As I got up, I knocked a pencil out of its holder.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我站起来时﹐碰掉了笔架上的一支铅笔。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: He knocked the knife from my hand.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他打落我手中的刀。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: At that moment, Sally knocked over her glass of wine.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 就在那时﹐萨莉把她那杯酒碰翻了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She tried to knock the gun aside but she was not fast enough.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她试图把枪推开﹐但来不及了。

Sense.DEF: to hit someone very hard
Sense.EXAMPLE: He knocked her to the ground and kicked her.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他把她打倒在地﹐还踢她。

GramExa.GLOSS: hit someone so hard that they fall unconscious
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Simon could knock a man unconscious with one punch to the jaw.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 西蒙往人下巴上打一拳就能把人击昏。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Garry answered the door only to be knocked flying as two policemen came rushing in.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 加里去开门﹐结果被冲进来的两名警察撞出老远。

Sense.DEF: to hit something with part of your body

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Morse knocked his shin against a suitcase that had been left just inside the door.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 莫尔斯胫部撞到了横在门内的手提箱上。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She knocked her head on a stone.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的头碰到了石头上。

Sense.DEF: to go to every house or apartment in an area asking the people who live there for information or support
Sense.TRAN: 〔为获取信息或寻求帮助〕挨家挨户敲门
Sense.EXAMPLE: Gathering that information means knocking on doors and asking people questions.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 收集那样的信息就意味着要挨家挨户敲门﹐向人们提问题。

Sense.DEF: to be wanting to join a group or team – used in news reports
Sense.TRAN: 要求加入某团体[小组]〔用于新闻报道中〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Five countries have permanent seats on the UN Security Council, but Germany and Japan, among others, are knocking on the door.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有五个国家拥有联合国安理会常任理事国席位﹐但包括德国﹑日本在内的其他国家也要求加入进来。

Sense.DEF: to remove a wall or part of a building in order to make a bigger room or space

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We could make a bigger living space by knocking two rooms into one.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们可以把两个房间打通﹐增大客厅空间。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The wall between the kitchen and the dining room has been partially knocked through.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 厨房和饭厅之间的墙已被部分打通。

Sense.DEF: to make a hole in something, especially a wall
Sense.EXAMPLE: We could knock a hole through the wall into the cupboard.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们可以在墙壁上打个洞通到壁橱里。

Sense.DEF: to criticize someone or their work, especially in an unfair or annoying way
Sense.EXAMPLE: The British press always knock British winners at any sport.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不管是何种体育项目﹐英国新闻界总是对获胜的英国选手吹毛求疵。
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘Designer fashion is silly.’ ‘Don’t knock it; it’s an important industry.’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “名牌时装傻得很。”“别挑刺了﹐那可是个重要的行业。

Sense.DEF: to kick or hit a ball somewhere
Sense.EXAMPLE: The aim is to knock the ball into the opposing goal.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 目标是把球踢进对方的球门。

Sense.DEF: to shock or upset someone very much or make them physically weak
Sense.TRAN: 使某人大为震惊[担心]﹔使某人浑身无力
Sense.EXAMPLE: This flu has really knocked me for six.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这场流感使我浑身乏力。

Sense.LEXUNIT: knock the stuffing out of sb
Sense.DEF: to make someone lose their confidence
Sense.EXAMPLE: Suzanne was very upset when her mother left home. It knocked the stuffing out of her.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 母亲离家出走使得苏珊娜苦恼不已﹐整个人变得萎靡不振。

Sense.DEF: to upset someone so much that it is difficult for them to deal with something
Sense.TRAN: 使某人目瞪口呆﹐使某人不知所措
Sense.EXAMPLE: His daughter’s death knocked Tom sideways.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 女儿的去世使汤姆大受打击。

Sense.LEXUNIT: knock some sense into sb/into sb’s head
Sense.DEF: to make someone learn to behave in a more sensible way
Sense.TRAN: 让某人汲取教训/懂事一些
Sense.EXAMPLE: The struggle to build up her own business had knocked some sense into her.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 创业的艰难经历使她得到了一些教训。

Sense.DEF: to tell people who are arguing that they must stop and behave more sensibly
Sense.TRAN: 制止(某人)争吵﹐使(某人)恢复理智
Sense.EXAMPLE: None of them can agree and it needs someone to knock heads together.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们各持己见﹐需要有人出面让他们别再吵了。

Sense.DEF: to stop something happening
Sense.EXAMPLE: We wanted to go for a picnic, but the rain’s knocked that on the head.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们原本打算去野餐﹐但是那场雨使计划泡汤了。

Sense.DEF: to surprise and please someone by being very impressive
Sense.EXAMPLE: With that dress, you’ll knock him dead.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你穿上那件连衣裙﹐准会给他一个大大的惊喜。

Sense.DEF: to stop admiring someone that you previously thought was perfect
Sense.TRAN: 使某人不再受崇拜﹐使某人威信扫地
Sense.EXAMPLE: The press were determined to knock the princess off the pedestal that they had put her on.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 新闻界决心把被他们捧上天去的王妃拉下来。

Sense.DEF: to be much better than someone or something
Sense.TRAN: 比某人/某物强得多﹐远远胜过某人/某物
Sense.EXAMPLE: The new computer system knocks spots off the old one.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 新的计算机系统比起旧的要好得多。

Sense.DEF: used to say that you hope your good luck so far will not change
used to tell someone to stop doing something, because it is annoying you
if an engine or pipes etc are knocking, they make a noise like something hard being hit, usually because something is wrong with them
Sense.TRAN: 〔发动机﹑管道等因故障而〕发出爆震[碰撞]声

Sense.DEF: if your heart is knocking, it is beating hard, especially because you are afraid
used when threatening to hit someone very hard
Sense.EXAMPLE: If you say that again, I’ll knock your head off!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果你再说那样的话﹐我就把你打个半死！

Sense.LEXUNIT: knock the bottom out of sth
Sense.DEF: to make something such as a market or industry fail suddenly
Sense.TRAN: 使〔市场或行业等〕骤然疲软[不景气]
Sense.EXAMPLE: A sudden drop in supplies of certain chemicals could knock the bottom out of the engineering industry.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 某些化学品供应的突然减少会造成工程行业一时间的不景气。

Crossrefto.REFLEX: knock/beat sb/sth into a cocked hat

Sense.DEF: to hit someone several times
Sense.EXAMPLE: My father used to knock me around.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 父亲以前经常打我。

Sense.DEF: to spend time somewhere, without doing anything very serious or important
Sense.EXAMPLE: On Saturdays I knock around with my friends.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 周六我都是和朋友们在一起玩。
Sense.EXAMPLE: We spent the day just knocking around the house.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们就在家里悠闲地过了一天。

Sense.DEF: to travel to different places
Sense.TRAN: 在某地四处旅行﹐漫游某地
Sense.EXAMPLE: For a couple of years we knocked around the Mediterranean.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们在地中海一带漫游了几年。

Sense.DEF: to discuss and think about an idea, plan etc with other people
Sense.EXAMPLE: We’ve been knocking around a few ideas.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们一直在讨论一些想法。

Sense.DEF: to play a game with a ball, but not in a serious way
if something or someone is knocking around, it is somewhere but you are not sure exactly where
Sense.EXAMPLE: Is there a screwdriver knocking about anywhere?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 哪儿有螺丝刀吗？

Sense.DEF: to quickly drink large quantities of a drink, especially an alcoholic drink
Sense.TRAN: 狂饮﹐豪饮〔尤指酒精饮料〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Brenda knocked the brandy back quickly.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 布伦达一口气喝光了白兰地。

Sense.DEF: to cost you a lot of money
Sense.EXAMPLE: His new car knocked him back several thousand dollars.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那辆新车花了他好几千美元。

Sense.DEF: to make someone feel upset, shocked, or physically weak
Sense.TRAN: 使某人感到生气[震惊﹐疲劳]

Sense.DEF: to hit or push someone so that they fall to the ground
Sense.EXAMPLE: Something hit him from behind and knocked him down.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有什么东西从后面击中了他﹐把他打倒在地。

Sense.DEF: to hit someone with a vehicle while you are driving, so that they are hurt or killed
Sense.EXAMPLE: A child was in hospital last night after being knocked down by a car.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 昨晚有个小孩被车撞倒﹐进了医院。

Sense.DEF: to destroy a building or part of a building
Sense.TRAN: 摧毁﹐拆毁〔建筑物或其中一部分〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: They want to knock the house down and rebuild it.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们要把这房子拆除重建。

Sense.DEF: to reduce the price of something by a large amount
Sense.EXAMPLE: The new stove we bought was knocked down from $800 to $550.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们新买的灶具从800美元降到了550美元。

Sense.DEF: to persuade someone to reduce the price of something they are selling you
Sense.TRAN: 说服某人降价﹐杀某人的价
Sense.EXAMPLE: She’s asking for £150 but I’ll try to knock her down to £100.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她要价150英镑﹐但我会想办法压到100英镑。

Sense.DEF: to make someone learn something
Sense.EXAMPLE: Parsons must knock these lessons into the team before Saturday.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 帕森斯必须在星期六之前对球队灌输这些教训。

Sense.DEF: to stop working and go somewhere else
Sense.EXAMPLE: There was no one in the office because they’d all knocked off for lunch.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 办公室里没人﹐因为他们都下班吃午饭去了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Do you want to knock off early today?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 今天你想早些下班吗？
Sense.EXAMPLE: We usually knock off work at about twelve on Saturday.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 星期六我们一般12点左右下班。

Sense.DEF: to reduce the price of something by a particular amount
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ll knock off £10.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我愿意降价10英镑。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Travel agents are knocking £50, and sometimes £100, off the price of holidays.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 旅行社正在把旅游报价调低50英镑﹐有些甚至降价100英镑。

Sense.DEF: to reduce a total by a particular amount

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Moving house will knock an hour off Ray’s journey to work.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 搬家将使雷的上班路程缩短一小时。

Sense.DEF: to produce something quickly and easily
Sense.TRAN: 〔快速轻松地〕做出某物﹐做完某事
Sense.EXAMPLE: Roland makes a lot of money knock­ing off copies of famous paintings.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 罗兰靠快速仿制名画赚大钱。

Sense.DEF: to murder someone
to steal something
to make someone become unconscious or go to sleep
Sense.TRAN: 使某人失去知觉﹔使某人睡着
Sense.EXAMPLE: The champion knocked Biggs out in the seventh round.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那位冠军在第七回合把比格斯打得失去了知觉。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: His head hit a table as he fell and he knocked himself out.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他跌倒时头撞在桌子上﹐昏了过去。

Sense.EXAMPLE: The nurse gave me some medicine which totally knocked me out.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 护士给我用了些药﹐我就昏睡过去了。

Sense.DEF: to defeat a person or team in a competition so that they can no longer take part
Sense.EXAMPLE: The German team were knocked out in the first round.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 德国队首轮即遭淘汰。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He first hit the headlines when he knocked Becker out of the French Open Tournament.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他在法国网球公开赛上淘汰了贝克尔﹐第一次上了头版头条。

Sense.DEF: to damage something so that it does not work
Sense.EXAMPLE: The air raids were planned to knock out communications on the ground.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 计划中空袭是为了摧毁地面通信。

Sense.DEF: if something knocks you out, it is very impressive and surprises you because it is so good
Sense.TRAN: 使某人倾倒﹐使某人大为赞赏
Sense.EXAMPLE: She loved the movie. It knocked her out.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她非常喜欢这部影片﹐对它赞叹不已。

Sense.DEF: to produce something easily and quickly
Sense.TRAN: 〔快速轻松地〕做出某物﹐做完某事
Sense.EXAMPLE: Paul has been knocking out new songs for the album.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 保罗在为这张专辑写出一首又一首新歌。

Sense.DEF: to work very hard in order to do something well
to hit someone with a vehicle while you are driving, so that they are hurt or killed
Sense.EXAMPLE: A woman was knocked over by a bus last year.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 去年有个女人被一辆公共汽车撞倒了。

Sense.DEF: to rob a place such as a shop or bank and threaten or attack the people who work there
to make something quickly, using whatever you have available
Sense.EXAMPLE: We should be able to knock something together with what’s in the fridge make a meal from items of food in the fridge.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 用冰箱里现成的东西﹐我们应该能凑出几道菜。

Sense.DEF: to make something quickly and without using much effort
Sense.EXAMPLE: Michael knocked up a shed in the back garden.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 迈克尔在后花园里匆匆搭了个棚屋。

Sense.DEF: to wake someone up by knocking on their door
Sense.EXAMPLE: What time do you want me to knock you up in the morning?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你想让我早上几点敲门叫醒你？

Sense.DEF: to make a woman pregnant
Sense.TRAN: 把〔女人〕肚子搞大﹐使〔女人〕怀孕

Sense.DEF: the sound of something hard hitting a hard surface
Sense.EXAMPLE: a loud knock at the door
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 很响的敲门声
Sense.EXAMPLE: a knock in the engine
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 发动机的爆震声

Sense.DEF: the action of something hard hitting your body
Sense.EXAMPLE: He got a knock on the head when he fell.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他跌落时撞到了头。

Sense.DEF: to have some bad luck or trouble
Sense.EXAMPLE: Clive’s taken quite a few hard knocks lately.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 克莱夫近来碰到不少倒霉事。

Sense.DEF: knockabout humour involves making fun of someone or something in a rough way, or behaving in a silly way
a refusal or rejection that you receive
a knockdown price is very cheap
when a boxer falls down when he is hit
a knock-down-drag-out argument or fight is an extremely angry or violent one
a piece of metal on an outside door of a house that you hit against the door to attract the attention of the people inside
an offensive word meaning a woman’s breasts
having knees that point slightly inwards
a cheap copy of something expensive
to start a process in which everything that happens causes something else to happen
Sense.EXAMPLE: These price rises will have a knock-on effect on the economy.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些价格的上涨将给经济带来连锁反应。

Sense.DEF: when a boxer hits his opponent so hard that he falls down and cannot get up again
Sense.EXAMPLE: The fight ended in a knockout.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这场比赛以一方被击倒而结束。

Sense.DEF: someone or something that is very attractive or successful
Sense.TRAN: 极有魅力的人[物]﹔非常成功的人[物]
Sense.EXAMPLE: Her dress was a knockout.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的连衣裙非常漂亮。

Sense.DEF: a type of competition in which only the winning players or teams at each stage continue to play until there is only one winner

Subsense.DEF: a hard hit that knocks someone down so that they cannot get up again
an action or event that causes defeat or failure
Subsense.EXAMPLE: High interest rates have been a knockout blow to the business.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 高利率对该企业构成了致命打击。

Sense.DEF: relating to a type of competition in which only the winning players or teams at each stage continue to play
Sense.EXAMPLE: Scotland’s failure to get through the knockout stage of the competition
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 苏格兰队在淘汰赛阶段的失利

Sense.DEF: pills etc that make someone unconscious
the time before a tennis match officially starts when the players hit the ball to each other for practice
a small round hill

Subsense.DEF: a part where one or more pieces of string, rope, cloth etc have been tied or twisted together
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Are you any good at tying knots?
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你擅长打结吗？
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Thread the string through the hoop and tie it in a knot.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 把线穿过环并打成结。

Subsense.DEF: a part where hair, a thread etc has become accidentally twisted together
Subsense.EXAMPLE: I can’t get the knots out of my hair.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我没法把打结的头发梳理开。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: There’s a knot in my shoelace.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我的鞋带上有个结。

PIC.HEADING: KNOT 结
PIC.PICCONTENT: bow 蝴蝶结；knot 绳结；loop 绳圈

Sense.DEF: a hair style in which your hair is arranged in a tight round shape on top of your head
a hard round place in a piece of wood where a branch once joined the tree
a unit for measuring the speed of ships and aircraft, equal to about 1,853 metres per hour
Sense.TRAN: 节〔船和飞机的速度单位﹐约合1,853 米/小时〕

Sense.DEF: a small group of people standing close together

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Knots of delegates stood around outside the conference centre.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 代表团成员三三两两地站在会议中心外。

Sense.DEF: a tight uncomfortable feeling caused by a strong emotion such as fear or anger
Sense.TRAN: 〔因恐惧或气愤等强烈感情引起的〕紧缩(感)﹐痉挛

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a knot of anxiety in her stomach
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她因焦虑而引起的腹部痉挛

Sense.EXAMPLE: Her stomach was in knots.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的胃揪成一团。

Sense.DEF: a tight painful place in a muscle
to tie together two ends or pieces of string, rope, cloth etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: A pretty scarf was loosely knotted around her neck.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的脖子上松松地系着一条漂亮的围巾。

Sense.DEF: if hair, a thread etc knots, it becomes twisted together
if a muscle or other part of your body knots, or is knotted, it feels tight and uncomfortable
Sense.TRAN: (使)〔肌肉〕暴突﹐(使)〔身体某部位〕紧揪
Sense.EXAMPLE: Fear and anxiety knotted her stomach.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 恐惧和焦虑使她感到腹部痉挛。

Sense.DEF: tied in a knot or in several knots
Sense.EXAMPLE: a knotted handkerchief on his head
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 系在他头上的一条手帕

Sense.DEF: if a muscle or other part of your body is knotted, it feels tight and uncomfortable
Sense.EXAMPLE: knotted shoulder muscles
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 暴突的肩部肌肉

Sense.DEF: used to tell someone rudely to go away or that you do not agree with them
knotted hands or fingers are twisted because of old age or too much work
Sense.TRAN: 〔手或手指因年老或过度劳累而〕骨节突出的

Sense.DEF: difficult to solve
Sense.EXAMPLE: a knotty problem
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 棘手的问题

Sense.DEF: knotty wood contains a lot of hard round places where branches once joined the tree
to have information about something
Sense.EXAMPLE: Who knows the answer?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 谁知道答案？
Sense.EXAMPLE: There are instructions telling you everything you need to know.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 操作指南会告诉你所有须知事项。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Didn’t you know that?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你不知道那件事吗？

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Do you know what time it is?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你知道现在几点吗？
GramExa.EXAMPLE: I don’t know where to go.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不知道去哪里。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I need to know more about the job before I decide whether to apply for it.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我要对这份工作多加了解再决定是否申请。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Little is known about the author’s childhood.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这位作者的童年几乎不为人知。

Sense.EXAMPLE: I know all about David and what he’s been up to!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我对戴维和他一直在干什么都知道得一清二楚！

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I wonder if he knew of the plan?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我在想他是不是知道这个计划？
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Do you know of any good restaurants in the area?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你知道这地方有什么好餐馆吗？
GramExa.EXAMPLE: You know nothing of this business.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你对这个行业一无所知。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We know that greenhouse gases can affect the climate.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们知道温室气体会对气候产生影响。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Let me know tell me what time you’re planning to arrive.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 请告诉我你打算什么时候到。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I thought you’d want to know immediately.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我以为你想马上知道。
Sense.EXAMPLE: If you must know, I was with James last night used when you are angry because someone wants to know something.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果你非要知道的话﹐我昨晚是和詹姆斯在一起。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He slipped out of the house without his parents knowing secretly.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他瞒着父母﹐偷偷溜出了家。

Sense.EXAMPLE: How did he know how did he find information about our names?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他是怎么知道我们姓名的？

GramExa.EXAMPLE: ‘I’m divorced, as you know,’ she said briefly.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: “我离婚了﹐你知道的。”她简短地说道。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Smoking is known to increase a person’s risk of developing lung cancer.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 人们知道﹐吸烟会增加罹患肺癌的风险。

Sense.DEF: to be sure about something
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘Are you seeing Jim tomorrow?’ ‘I don’t know yet.’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “你明天要去见吉姆吗？”“我还没有确定。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I know I won’t get the job.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我知道我不会得到这份工作。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Ruth knew that she couldn’t continue in the relationship for much longer.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 露丝知道她无法再把这段关系维持下去了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I know exactly what you need!
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我很清楚你需要什么！

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The boy stared at him uncertainly, not knowing whether to believe him.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 那男孩疑惑地盯着他﹐不知道是否应该相信他。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: I don’t know if I’ll be able to come.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不清楚自己是否能来。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She forced herself to go out, knowing that she would feel more depressed if she stayed at home.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她强迫自己出去﹐知道如果待在家里会更加抑郁。

Sense.EXAMPLE: How do you know what makes you sure he won’t do it again?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你怎么确定他不会再干那事？

GramExa.EXAMPLE: It’s a story that I know to be true.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个故事我知道是真实的。

Sense.EXAMPLE: I think he’s still living in Chicago, but I don’t know for sure.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我想他还住在芝加哥﹐但我不确定。
Sense.EXAMPLE: As far as I know, they’re arriving on Saturdayused when you think something is true but are not sure.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 据我所知﹐他们会在星期六到。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I doubt I’ll win, but you never know used when you cannot be sure about something, but something good might happen.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我怀疑自己赢不了﹐但谁也说不准。

Sense.DEF: to be familiar with a person, place etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ve known her for twenty years.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我认识她有20年了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Are you really thinking of leaving Kevin for a guy you barely know?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你真的考虑要为了一个几乎不了解的人而离开凯文吗？
Sense.EXAMPLE: Do you know the nightclub on the corner of Maine Street?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你知道缅因街街角的那家夜总会吗？
Sense.EXAMPLE: I don’t know him very well.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不是很了解他。
Sense.EXAMPLE: We’re still getting to know each other really.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 其实我们还处于相互了解的阶段。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I know her from school.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我从上学的时候就认识她了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Many people knew him as a local businessman.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 许多人知道他是当地的一位商人。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Hepburn is best known for people are most likely to be familiar with her roles in classic films such as ‘My Fair Lady’.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 赫本最为人们熟知的是她在《窈窕淑女》等经典影片中扮演的角色。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The museum outlines the development of the city as we know it today.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 博物馆勾勒了这个我们现在熟悉的城市的发展过程。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Does he know the way to your house know how to get there?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他知道去你家的路吗？
Sense.EXAMPLE: I grew up here; I know the place like the back of my hand I know it very well.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我就在这里长大﹐对这个地方了如指掌。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I only know her by sight I often see her but have not really spoken to her.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我和她只是面熟而已。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She didn’t know me from Adam she did not know me at all, but she was really helpful.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她和我素不相识﹐却很乐意帮忙。

GramExa.GLOSS: used to say that you expect someone to behave in a particular way because you know them well
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Knowing Sumi, my note’s probably still in her pocket.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我了解寿美﹐我的字条很可能还在她的口袋里呢。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: He’ll be chatting up the women, if I know Ron!
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他会和女人搭讪的﹐我了解罗恩！

Sense.DEF: to realize, find out about, or under­stand something
Sense.EXAMPLE: Hardly knowing what he was doing, Nick pulled out a cigarette.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 尼克下意识地掏出了一支烟。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She knew the risks involved.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她知道其中的风险。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Suddenly she knew that some­thing was terribly wrong.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 突然她意识到出了大问题。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I didn’t know how difficult it would be.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不知道会有多难。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She knows not to tell anyone.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她知道不可以告诉任何人。

GramExa.GLOSS: used to ask if someone understands or has the same feeling as you
GramExa.EXAMPLE: It’s nice to have a change sometimes. Know what I mean?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 有时候改变一下真不错。 你明白我的意思吗？

GramExa.PROPFORM: if you know what I mean
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Sometimes it’s better not to ask too many questions, if you know what I mean.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 有时候最好别问太多问题﹐你知道我的意思吧。

Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘I just felt so tired.’ ‘Yeah, I know what you mean.’ I understand, because I have had the same experience
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “我就是感觉累得很。“是啊﹐我懂你的意思。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I should have known it wouldn’t be easy.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我早该知道这事不容易。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I might have known I am annoyed but not surprised you would take that attitude.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我就知道你会采取那种态度。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I know exactly how you feel.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我很清楚你的感受。

GramExa.PROPFORM: know perfectly well/full well/only too well
GramExa.EXAMPLE: He knew full well that what he was doing was dangerous.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他非常清楚自己做的事情很危险。

GramExa.PROPFORM: sb will never know/no one will ever know
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Just take it. No one will ever know.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 把它拿走吧﹐没人会知道。

Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘That’s not what I mean, and you know it,’ he protested.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “我不是那个意思﹐你明明知道的。”他抗议道。

GramExa.PROPFORM: if I had known/if I’d have known
GramExa.EXAMPLE: I wouldn’t have come if I’d known you were so busy.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 要是知道你这么忙的话﹐我就不会来了。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Little did she know she did not know that years later she would have her own pool and luxury apartment in Florida.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她根本没想到﹐多年以后她会在佛罗里达州拥有自己的游泳池和豪华公寓。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She knew nothing of what had happened earlier that day.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对那天早些时候发生的事情﹐她一无所知。

Sense.DEF: to have learned a lot about something or be skilful and expe­rienced at doing something
Sense.EXAMPLE: I don’t know enough his­tory to make a comparison.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我对历史还不够精通﹐无法加以比较。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I taught him everything he knows.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他知道的一切都是我教的。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I know some French.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我懂一些法语。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Do you know how to change a fuse?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你知道怎么换保险丝吗？

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I have a friend who knows about antiques.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我有一个懂古玩的朋友。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Bessie knew nothing about football.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 贝茜对足球一窍不通。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Politicians know all about the power of language.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 政治家都深谙语言的力量。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: I don’t know the first thing about I know nothing about looking after children.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我对照看小孩一无所知。

Sense.EXAMPLE: I don’t really know what I’m doing I do not have enough skill and experience to deal with something when it comes to cars.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 说到汽车﹐我可是一点都不懂。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The staff are dedicated people who clearly know what they are talking about.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些员工有敬业精神﹐而且非常懂行。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She knew from experience that exams made her very nervous.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 根据以往的经验﹐她知道考试会让她神经紧张。

GramExa.GLOSS: be good at and know all you should about a job or subject
GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 对自己的工作/学科/活儿很在行

Sense.EXAMPLE: a decent manager who knows the ropes has a lot of experience
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一位经验丰富的优秀经理
Sense.EXAMPLE: My cousin knows a thing or two know a lot about about golf.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我的表弟对高尔夫球很在行。

GramExa.GLOSS: be able to sing a song, play a tune, say a poem etc because you have learned it
GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 会唱某一首歌/会哼某一段曲调/会背诵某一首诗等
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Do you know all the words to ‘As Time Goes By’?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你知道《当时光流逝》这首歌的全部歌词吗？

Sense.DEF: to think that someone has particular qualities
Sense.TRAN: 认为﹐知道〔某人具备某种品质〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I knew him as a hard-working, modest, and honest politician.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我认为他是一位勤奋﹑谦虚而又诚实的政治家。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: In fact, I knew her for a tough-minded young woman.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 其实﹐我知道她是个意志坚强的年轻女性。

Subsense.DEF: to be wise or experienced enough not to do something
Subsense.TRAN: 懂得〔不应该做某事〕﹐不至于蠢到〔做某事〕
Subsense.EXAMPLE: It’s just prejudice from educated people who should know better.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这只是受过教育的人的偏见﹐这些人本不该这样想。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Eva knew better than to interrupt one of Mark’s jokes.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 伊娃不会傻到去打断马克的笑话。

Subsense.DEF: to know or think you know more than someone else
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Everyone thought it was an accident. Only Dan knew better.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 人人都以为那是一次意外事故﹐只有丹更清楚实情。

Sense.DEF: used to say that someone does something bad or stupid because they have not been told or taught that it is wrong
Sense.TRAN: 不明真相﹐不明就里〔因而做了坏事或傻事〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Drugs are being sold to children who don’t know any better.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 毒品在卖给不知就里的小孩子。

Sense.DEF: to be very familiar with something, especially because you have learned about it or because you have a lot of experience
Sense.TRAN: 对某事了如指掌﹐对某事十分了解
Sense.EXAMPLE: Erikson knows the game inside out.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 埃里克松精通此道。

Subsense.DEF: to be so familiar with something that you are confident and good at using it
Subsense.EXAMPLE: She knows her way around a wine list.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她对酒水单了如指掌。

Subsense.DEF: to be familiar with a place so that you know where things are
Subsense.EXAMPLE: I don’t know my way around the city yet.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我对这座城市还不熟悉。

Sense.DEF: to introduce yourself to someone
Sense.EXAMPLE: After she had gone, Paul made himself known to Dr Heatherton.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她离去后﹐保罗对希瑟顿医生作了自我介绍。

Sense.DEF: to be able to recognize someone or something
Sense.EXAMPLE: Honestly, it had been so long, I hardly knew her.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 说实话﹐过了这么长时间我几乎认不出她了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He looked very different, but I knew him by his voice.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他看上去变了很多﹐但我听声音知道是他。

Sense.DEF: to have a particular name
Sense.EXAMPLE: The main street between the castle and the palace is known as ‘the Royal Mile’.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 城堡和皇宫之间的那条大街名叫“皇家大道”。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Nitrous oxide is commonly known as laughing gas.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一氧化二氮通常被称作笑气。

Sense.DEF: to understand the difference between one thing and another
Sense.TRAN: 分辨事物﹐知道事物间的差异
Sense.EXAMPLE: Lloyd doesn’t even know his right from his left.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 劳埃德甚至分不清左右。
Sense.EXAMPLE: At what age do children start to know right from wrong?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 儿童到什么年龄开始懂得分辨是非？

Sense.DEF: to have experience of a particular feeling or situation
Sense.EXAMPLE: I don’t think he ever knew true happiness.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我想他根本不知道什么叫真正的幸福。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I know all about being poor.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我完全知道穷是什么滋味。

Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ve never known have never experienced this to happen in all the time I’ve worked here.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我在这里工作了这么久﹐从来没有遇到过这种事。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ve never known him to shout he never shouts.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我从来没有听到他大声喊叫过。

Sense.LEXUNIT: sb/sth is not known to be sthorsb/sth has never been known to do sth
Sense.DEF: used to say there is no information that someone or something has particular qualities
Sense.TRAN: 据说某人/某事物不是某种情况/不会做某事
Sense.EXAMPLE: This species is not known to be vicious.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 据说这种动物并不凶猛。

Sense.LEXUNIT: I’ve known sb/sth to do sthorsb/sth has been known to do sth
Sense.DEF: used to say that someone does something sometimes or that something happens sometimes, even if it is unusual
Sense.TRAN: 我知道某人做过某事/发生了某种情况〔尽管并不常见〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: People have been known to drive 500 miles just to visit the shop.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有人驾车500英里只是为了去这家商店。
Sense.EXAMPLE: This type of fish has been known to live for 10 years or more.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这种鱼有活10年甚至更久的。

Subsense.DEF: used to emphasize a statement
Subsense.EXAMPLE: There’s no excuse, you know.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你要知道﹐没什么借口好找的。

Subsense.DEF: used to make sure that someone understands what you are saying
Subsense.TRAN: 知道吗﹐懂吗〔用以确定别人理解你的话〕
Subsense.EXAMPLE: I felt very upset, you know?
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我觉得心里很烦﹐懂吗？

Subsense.DEF: used when you want to keep someone’s attention, but cannot think of what to say next
Subsense.TRAN: 要知道﹐是这样〔想要让别人继续关注﹐但又不知道接下去说什么〕
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Well, you know, we’ve got a job to do here.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 嗯﹐要知道﹐我们在这里有活儿要干。

Subsense.DEF: used when you are explaining or describing something and want to give more information
Subsense.TRAN: 你知道的〔对某事进行解释或描述时想要提供更多的信息〕
Subsense.EXAMPLE: That flower in the garden – you know, the purple one – what is it?
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 花园里的那种花﹐你知道﹐就是紫色的那种﹐它叫什么？

Sense.DEF: used to start talking about something, or make someone listen
Sense.TRAN: 你知道吗〔用来引出话题或让人注意听〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: You know, I sometimes feel I don’t know him at all.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你知道吗﹐我有时候感觉自己一点都不了解他。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Do you know, when I went out this morning that man was still there.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你知道吗﹐今天早晨我出去时﹐那个男人还在那里。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: You know what? I think he’s lonely.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你知道吗﹐我觉得他很孤单。

Subsense.DEF: used to agree with someone or to say that you feel the same way
Subsense.TRAN: 我理解﹐我有同感〔用来表示同意某人的观点或表示自己有同感〕
Subsense.EXAMPLE: ‘We have to talk about it, Rob.’ ‘Yeah, I know.’
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: “罗布﹐这件事我们得谈谈。”“好啊﹐我也这么想。

Subsense.DEF: used to say that you have suddenly had an idea, thought of a solution to a problem etc
Subsense.TRAN: 有了﹐我知道了〔表示突然想到一个主意﹑解决办法等〕
Subsense.EXAMPLE: I know! Let’s go out for a meal on your birthday.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有了！你生日那天我们出去吃饭吧。

Subsense.DEF: used to stop someone from interrupting because they have an opinion about what you are saying
Subsense.TRAN: 我知道〔用来阻止别人打断你的话〕
Subsense.EXAMPLE: It sounds silly, I know, but I will explain.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这听起来很傻﹐我知道﹐但我会解释的。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: I know, I know, I should have had the car checked out before now.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我知道﹐我知道﹐我应该事先把汽车检查一下的。

Subsense.DEF: used to say that you do not have the answer to a question
Subsense.TRAN: 我不知道﹐我不清楚〔表示不知道问题的答案〕
Subsense.EXAMPLE: ‘When did they arrive?’ ‘I don’t know.’
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: “他们是什么时候到的？”“我不知道。”

Subsense.DEF: used when you are not sure about something
Subsense.EXAMPLE: ‘How old do you think he is?’ ‘Oh, I don’t know – sixty, seventy?’
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: “你觉得他有多大年纪？”“哦﹐我不清楚。 60﹐70？”

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I don’t know whether to call him.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我拿不定主意是否要给他打电话。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I don’t know that you need a passport for travelling within the EU.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不能肯定你在欧盟国家范围内旅行要不要护照。

Subsense.DEF: used to show that you disagree slightly with what has just been said
Subsense.TRAN: 我倒不这么认为〔表示不大同意别人说的话〕
Subsense.EXAMPLE: ‘I couldn’t live there.’ ‘Oh, I don’t know. It might not be so bad.’
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: “我没法在那里生活。”“噢﹐我倒不这么认为﹐可能没那么糟吧。”

Subsense.DEF: used to show that you are slightly annoyed
Subsense.TRAN: 真想不到〔表示有点不高兴〕
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Oh, I don’t know! You’re hopeless!
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 唉﹐真是的！ 你无药可救了！

Sense.DEF: used to criticize someone
Sense.TRAN: 真想不到怎么/为什么等〔用于批评某人〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: I don’t know how people could keep an animal in those conditions.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我真想不到怎么会有人把动物养在那样的环境里。

Sense.LEXUNIT: I don’t know about you, but...
Sense.DEF: used to give your opinion, decision, or suggestion when you are not sure that the person you are talking to will feel the same way
Sense.TRAN: 我不知道你怎么想﹐但是…〔用于对别人提出观点﹑决定或建议﹐但又不确定别人是否看法一致〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: I don’t know about you, but I’ll be glad when Christmas is over.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不知道你怎么想﹐我是希望圣诞节早点结束。

Sense.LEXUNIT: I don’t know how to thank you/repay you
Sense.DEF: used to thank someone
Sense.TRAN: 我真不知道该怎么谢你/回报你

Sense.DEF: used to say that something is not at all surprising
Sense.TRAN: 难道你不知道〔表示一点也不奇怪〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: I was told in no uncertain terms that Helen, wouldn’t you know it, didn’t approve.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 别人肯定地告诉我说海伦不赞成﹐难道你不知道？

Sense.DEF: used to emphasize how strong your feelings are
Sense.TRAN: 你不知道﹐你不懂〔强调感情的强烈程度〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: You don’t know how much I missed him.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你不知道我那时多么惦念他。

Sense.DEF: used to say that you do not know the answer to something and that you are not the person who would know
Sense.TRAN: 我可不知道﹐我可不清楚〔表示你不知道某事的答案﹐而且也不是应该知道此事的人〕

Sense.DEF: used to say angrily that someone’s opinion is wrong or that it is not important
Sense.TRAN: 某人懂什么？〔气愤地表示某人的观点不对或不重要〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: What does she know about relationships?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 恋爱的事她懂些什么？

Sense.LEXUNIT: how should I know?/how am I to know?/how do I know?
Sense.DEF: used to say that it is not reasonable to expect that you should know something
Sense.TRAN: 我怎么知道？我怎么会知道？〔表示要求你知道某事是没有道理的〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘When will they be back?’ ‘How should I know?’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “他们什么时候回来？”“我怎么知道？”

Sense.LEXUNIT: how was I to know?/how did I know?
Sense.DEF: used as an excuse when something bad has happened
Sense.TRAN: 我怎么知道？我怎么会知道？〔发生不好的事后用来作借口〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: How was I to know that the file was confidential?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我怎么会知道这是一份机密文件？

Sense.DEF: used to say that you do not mind that someone has made a mistake because they could not have avoided it
Sense.TRAN: 是不知道的﹐不是故意的〔表示不在意某人的错误﹐因为他们无法避免〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘Sorry, I didn’t realize you had guests.’ ‘That’s all right – you weren’t to know.’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “很抱歉﹐我没想到你有客人。”“没关系﹐你又不知道。”

Sense.DEF: used to emphasize that you know about something because you made it, experienced it etc
Sense.TRAN: 我应该知道〔强调你知道某事﹐因为你做过或经历过等〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘Are you sure there’s no sugar in this coffee?’ ‘Of course. I ought to know – I made it!’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “你肯定这杯咖啡里没有糖吗？”“当然肯定﹐我自己冲的我还不知道！”

Sense.DEF: used to emphasize that you do not know something and say that it is not important to you
Sense.TRAN: 我不知道﹐说不定〔强调你不知道某事﹐而且也不在乎〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: I don’t know where she is. She could have been kidnapped for all I know.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不知道她在哪里﹐说不定她被人绑架了。

Sense.DEF: used to say that you think the answer is ‘no’ but there may be facts that you do not know about
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘Did he call earlier?’ ‘Not that I know of.’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “他早些时候来过电话吗？”“据我所知没有。”

Subsense.DEF: used to say that you do not know the answer to a question
Subsense.TRAN: 天知道！天晓得！谁知道！〔表示不知道问题的答案〕
Subsense.EXAMPLE: ‘Where do you think he’s disappeared to this time?’ ‘God knows!’
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: “你说这回他去哪里了呢？”“天知道！”
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Goodness knows why she didn’t go herself.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 天知道她为什么不自己去。

Subsense.DEF: used to emphasize a statement
Subsense.TRAN: 天知道﹐老天作证〔用于强调〕
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Goodness knows, I’ve never liked the woman, but I didn’t know how bad it would be to work with her.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 老天作证﹐我从来就不喜欢这女人﹐可我也不知道和她一起工作会这么糟糕。

Sense.DEF: used to say that you expect something bad will happen because you are usually unlucky
Sense.TRAN: 知道自己不走运﹐知道自己向来就运气不好
Sense.EXAMPLE: Knowing my luck, the train will be late.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我知道自己向来倒霉﹐这趟火车要晚点了。

Sense.DEF: used to express surprise
Sense.EXAMPLE: Well, what do you know? Look who’s here!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 啊﹐真没想到﹐看看谁来了！

Sense.LEXUNIT: if you know what’s good for you
Sense.DEF: used to tell someone that they should do something, or something bad will happen
Sense.TRAN: 假如你知道好歹的话﹐如果你识相的话
Sense.EXAMPLE: You’ll keep your mouth shut about this if you know what’s good for you!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果你知道好歹的话﹐就别把这事说出去！

Sense.DEF: used to talk about someone or something without mentioning their name
Sense.TRAN: 你知道的那个人/东西〔用于谈论某人或某物而不指名道姓〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: I saw you know who yesterday.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 昨天我看到那谁了。

Sense.DEF: it is impossible to know
Sense.EXAMPLE: There was no knowing who might have read the letter.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 无法知道谁可能已经看过这封信了。

Sense.LEXUNIT: let it be known/make it known (that)
Sense.DEF: to make sure that people know something, especially by getting someone else to tell them
Sense.TRAN: 使人知道(…)﹐让人知晓(…)〔尤指通过别人传达〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Farrar let it be known that he saw nothing wrong with the proposed solutions.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 法勒已公开表示他认为所提出的解决方案没有问题。

Sense.DEF: to not be interested in someone and what they want to say
Sense.EXAMPLE: She’d approached several model agencies but they just didn’t want to know.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她联系过几家模特经纪公司﹐但他们全都不感兴趣。

Sense.DEF: to understand a situation and all the good and bad features about it
Sense.EXAMPLE: I knew the score before I started the job.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我开始这份工作之前心中就有数了。

Sense.DEF: to feel shocked and confused because something happens when you are not expecting it to
Sense.EXAMPLE: Poor man – I don’t think he knew what hit him.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 可怜的人﹐我想他是惊呆了。

Sense.DEF: used to say that someone under­stands that they are less important than other people –usually used humorously
Sense.TRAN: 有自知之明﹐知道自己位置何在〔一般为幽默用法〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: I know my place. I’ll get back to the kitchen!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我有自知之明﹐我会回厨房去的！

Sense.DEF: if a feeling or quality knows no bounds, it is not limited in any way
Sense.EXAMPLE: His enthusiasm knew no bounds.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的热情无穷无尽。

Sense.DEF: used to say that someone should be obeyed or that their way of doing things should be accepted because they are experienced
Sense.EXAMPLE: She always thinks she knows best.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她总是认为自己最懂。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I have always hated the attitude that ‘the doctor knows best’.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我一向讨厌那种“医生最懂”的态度。

Sense.DEF: used to say that something happens very quickly and when you are not expecting it
Sense.EXAMPLE: You’ll be home before you know it.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一眨眼工夫你就会到家了。

Sense.DEF: to know that the opposite of something is true
Sense.EXAMPLE: He told people he didn’t care about her, but deep down he knew different.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他告诉别人说不在乎她﹐但心底里却知道不是那么回事。

Sense.DEF: to be confident and have firm ideas about what you want and like

Sense.LEXUNIT: you will be delighted/pleased etc to know (that)
Sense.DEF: used before you give someone information that they will be pleased to hear
Sense.TRAN: 你要是知道(…)准会高兴的
Sense.EXAMPLE: You will be pleased to know that we have accepted your offer.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你要是知道了准会很高兴的﹐我们已接受了你的提议。

Sense.LEXUNIT: it’s ..., Jim, but not as we know it
Sense.DEF: used to say that something is completely different from what we would normally expect something of its type to be
Sense.TRAN: 那算是…﹐但不是我们所熟悉的那种
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s the blues, Jim, but not as we know it.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那算是布鲁斯音乐吧﹐但不是我们所熟悉的那种。

Crossrefto.REFLEX: the next thing I/she etc knew

Sense.DEF: having more information about something than most people
Sense.EXAMPLE: People in the know say that interest rates will have to rise again soon.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 知情人士说﹐利率将很快再次上升。

Sense.DEF: someone who behaves as if they know everything – used to show disapproval
Sense.TRAN: 自以为无所不知的人〔含贬义〕

Sense.DEF: knowledge, practical ability, or skill to do something
Sense.EXAMPLE: those who have the know-how to exploit the technology to the fullest
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那些知道如何将技术发挥到最大限度的人

GramExa.EXAMPLE: by today’s practising lawyer
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 当今执业律师所需的知识

Sense.EXAMPLE: No other company had the technical know-how to deal with the disaster.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 其他公司都不具备应对这一灾难所必需的技术知识。

Sense.DEF: showing that you know all about something, even if it has not been discussed directly
Sense.EXAMPLE: He gave us a knowing look.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他朝我们会意地看了一眼。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She exchanged a knowing smile with her mother.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她与母亲相互会心地一笑。

Sense.DEF: in a way that shows you know about something secret or embarrass­ing
Sense.EXAMPLE: The two women smiled knowingly at each other.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 两个女人会意地相视一笑。

Sense.DEF: deliberately
Sense.EXAMPLE: He would never knowingly upset people.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他从来不会故意惹别人生气。

Sense.DEF: someone who behaves as if they know everything – used to show disapproval
Sense.TRAN: 自以为无所不知的人〔含贬义〕

Sense.DEF: the information, skills, and understanding that you have gained through learning or experience
Sense.EXAMPLE: He did not have much knowledge of American history.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他对美国历史所知不多。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the need to increase knowledge about birth control
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 提高节育知识的需要

F2NBox.HEADING: REGISTER 语体
F2NBox.EXPL: In everyday English, people usually say that someone knows about something rather than has knowledge of/about something.
F2NBox.TRAN: 在日常英语中﹐人们一般说某人 knows about something ﹐而不说 has knowledge of/about something
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: He didn’t know much about American history.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 他对美国历史所知不多 。

Sense.DEF: when you know about a particular situation or event, or the information you have about it
Sense.EXAMPLE: Evans denied all knowledge of the robbery.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 埃文斯说他对这次抢劫一无所知。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I had no knowledge of this whatsoever until The Times contacted me.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在《泰晤士报》和我联系之前﹐我对这件事毫不知情。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Kay smiled, secure in the knowledge that she was right.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 凯微笑着﹐知道自己是对的她就放心了。

GramExa.GLOSS: be known about by everyone
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Their affair is public knowledge.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他俩的风流韵事已是尽人皆知。

GramExa.GLOSS: used to say that someone may not know the true facts
GramExa.EXAMPLE: To the best of my knowledge, the new project will be starting in June.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 据我所知﹐这个新项目将于6月份开始。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: To our knowledge, this is the first time it’s happened.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 就我们所知﹐此事是第一次发生。

Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘Is it true that she’s leaving the company?’ ‘Not to my knowledge I do not think so.’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “她真要离开公司了吗？”“我不这么想。”

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He was annoyed to find the contract had been signed without his knowledge.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他发觉有人背着他签了合同﹐这让他很生气。

Sense.EXAMPLE: She acted with the full knowledge of her boss her boss knew about her action.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她是在老板完全知情的情况下行事的。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Ministers publicly denied that they had prior knowledge of the attack they denied that they knew that it was going to happen.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 大臣们公开否认他们事先知道会发生袭击。

F2NBox.HEADING: GRAMMAR 语法
F2NBox.EXPL: Knowledgeis an uncountable noun and has no plural form. Use a singular verb after it.
F2NBox.TRAN: knowledge 是不可数名词﹐没有复数形式﹐后面要跟单数动词

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The book assumes that you already have some knowledge of physics.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 这本书针对具备一定物理知识的读者。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: He gets all his knowledge about politics from watching the television.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他所有政治方面的知识都是看电视得来的。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: If you want to improve your knowledge of the language, you should go and live in France.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果你想提高法语水平﹐就应该去法国居住。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The course is designed to help students broaden their knowledge of modern American literature.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 这门课程旨在帮助学生更多地了解现代美国文学。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The test should be an opportunity for students to demonstrate their knowledge.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 这项测验应该可以让学生有机会展示自己的知识。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: knowledge about a lot of different subjects
Collocate.EXAMPLE: The questions are intended to test your general knowledge.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些问题是为了测试你的常识。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: the practical application of scientific knowledge
Making profitable investments requires specialist knowledge.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 做可赢利的投资需要有专业知识。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: You need to have a detailed knowledge of criminal law.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 你要具备详尽的刑法知识。

Collocate.COLLOCTRAN: 直接获得/从亲身经历获得的知识
Collocate.EXAMPLE: writers who had no first-hand knowledge of war
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 没有亲身经历过战争的作家

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: knowledge of the basic aspects of something
Collocate.EXAMPLE: These things are obvious to anyone with even a basic knowledge of computers.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 对于任何只懂得基本电脑知识的人而言﹐这些东西也都是显而易见的。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: detailed knowledge about all of a particular subject
knowledge about something because you are involved in it
knowledge that you have because you are part of a group
knowledge that you need before you can understand or do something

Collocate.EXAMPLE: She arrived at college with a thirst for knowledge.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 她怀着求知若渴的心情来到大学。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: when you know a lot about all the different parts of something
Collocate.EXAMPLE: They lack his breadth of knowledge about the industry.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们缺乏像他那样对这一行业的广博知识。

ErrorBox.HINTTRAN: Do not say 不要说 ‘learn knowledge’. Say 而要说 gain knowledge or 或 acquire knowledge.

Exponent.DEF: the facts and information that you have learned, and the understanding you have gained
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Our knowledge of other cultures and societies has improved.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们对其他文化和社会的了解增加了。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: scientific knowledge
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 科学知识

Exponent.DEF: special knowledge about how to do something, that you get through experience, training, or study
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The technical expertise was provided by a Japanese company.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 技术知识由一家日本公司提供。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: They need people with medical expertise.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们需要具备专业医学知识的人才。

Exponent.DEF: practical knowledge about how to do something
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Business leaders often lack the local know-how to tackle problems in specific countries.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 企业领导者往往缺乏应对当地实际情况的技巧﹐难以解决在某些国家遇到的问题。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: financial know-how
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 实用金融知识

Exponent.DEF: good sense and judgment, based on knowledge and experience
Exponent.EXAMPLE: the wisdom of the older family members
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 家庭中长者的智慧
Exponent.EXAMPLE: It’s a matter of common wisdom that newspapers cannot be trusted.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 报纸不可信﹐这是常识。

Exponent.DEF: how much you know about a situation or subject, and how well you understand it
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He’s been praised for his grasp of the country’s economic problems.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他因对该国经济问题的理解把握而受到赞扬。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: She has a good grasp of the language.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 她充分掌握这门语言。

Sense.DEF: knowing a lot

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Graham’s very knowledgeable about wines.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 格雷厄姆对葡萄酒很在行。

Sense.DEF: the past participle of know
used about something that people know about or have discovered
Sense.EXAMPLE: a study of all the known facts
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对所有已知事实的研究
Sense.EXAMPLE: her last known address
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她最后一个为人所知的地址
Sense.EXAMPLE: Apart from vaccines, there is no known way to protect against meningitis.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 除了使用疫苗外﹐还未发现其他预防脑膜炎的方法。

Sense.DEF: a known criminal, drug dealer etc is someone who people know to be regularly involved in criminal activities or to do other things that are disapproved of
Sense.TRAN: 〔罪犯﹑贩毒者等〕已知的﹐出了名的
Sense.EXAMPLE: He was found with several other known sex offenders.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他被发现和另外几个众所周知的性犯罪者在一起。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a known liar
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 出了名的说谎者

Sense.DEF: to be famous or known about by a lot of people because of something
Sense.TRAN: 以某事知名﹐以某物闻名
Sense.EXAMPLE: He’s known for his good looks.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他长得帅是出了名的。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The region is known for its fine wines.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个地区以出产优质葡萄酒闻名。

Sense.DEF: used when saying how famous someone is
Sense.TRAN: 〔人〕知名的/没有名气的/不大出名的
Sense.EXAMPLE: works by lesser-known French artists
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不太出名的法国画家的作品

Sense.DEF: your knuckles are the joints in your fingers, including the ones where your fingers join your hands
Sense.EXAMPLE: Her knuckles whitened as she gripped the gun.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她紧紧握着枪﹐指关节都发白了。

Sense.DEF: a piece of meat around the lowest leg joint of a pig
Sense.EXAMPLE: a knuckle of pork
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 猪肘子

Sense.DEF: rude, or likely to give offence
Sense.EXAMPLE: Some of his jokes are a bit near the knuckle.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的一些笑话有点下流。

Sense.DEF: to suddenly start working or studying hard
Sense.EXAMPLE: If he doesn’t knuckle down soon, he’ll never get through those exams.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他如果不快点用功﹐肯定通不过那些考试。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He is clearly ready to knuckle down to the task.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 显然他已准备认真着手这项任务。

Sense.DEF: to accept someone’s authority or orders although you do not want to
a man who is stupid
a piece of metal that covers all the knuckles of the hand, used as a weapon
someone stupid – used when you are not very angry with them
Sense.TRAN: 笨蛋﹐傻瓜〔不是很生气时使用〕
the abbreviation of 缩写= knock­out 〔拳击比赛中的〕击倒对手

Sense.DEF: to hit someone so hard that they become unconscious
an Australian animal like a small grey bear with no tail that climbs trees and eats leaves
Sense.TRAN: 树袋熊﹐无尾熊﹐考拉〔产于澳大利亚〕

Sense.DEF: a black pencil used around women’s eyes to make them more attractive
a vegetable of the cabbage family
someone who is silly or crazy
an Australian bird whose song sounds like laughter
Sense.TRAN: 笑翠鸟〔产于澳大利亚﹐鸣叫声似笑声〕

Sense.DEF: a West African harp which has 21 strings and a sound box made from a gourd
Sense.TRAN: 科拉琴〔一种西非竖琴﹐21弦﹐其圆形琴体以葫芦做成〕

Sense.DEF: the holy book of the Muslims
an Indian dish made with meat and cream
Sense.TRAN: 印度咖喱肉〔一种用肉和奶油做成的印度菜肴〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: chicken korma
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 印度咖喱鸡

Subsense.DEF: kosher food is prepared according to Jewish law
kosher restaurants or shops sell food prepared in this way
Subsense.TRAN: 〔餐馆或商店〕供应符合犹太教规食物的

Sense.DEF: something that is kosher is honest, legal, or really what it is claimed to be
Sense.TRAN: 诚实可靠的﹔合法的﹔真实的
Sense.EXAMPLE: Are you sure this offer is kosher?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你肯定这个报价是实价吗？

Sense.DEF: to be too eager to obey or be polite to someone in authority

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We will not kowtow to the government.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们不会对政府卑躬屈膝。

Sense.DEF: work that soldiers or children at a camp have to do in a kitchen
used to describe the speed of something, especially a vehicle or the wind
Sense.TRAN: 千米/小时﹐公里/小时〔尤用于车速或风速〕

Sense.DEF: a village in South Africa with a fence around it
Sense.TRAN: 〔在南非用栅栏围起来的〕栅栏村庄

Sense.DEF: a very offensive word for someone from Germany. Do not use this word.
the government of Russia and the former USSR, or its buildings in Moscow
Sense.TRAN: 俄罗斯政府﹔苏联政府﹔克里姆林宫

Sense.DEF: small shellfish
another name for santa claus
the standard unit of money in Sweden and Iceland
Sense.TRAN: 克朗〔瑞典和冰岛的标准货币单位〕

Sense.DEF: the standard unit of money in Denmark and Norway
Sense.TRAN: 克朗〔丹麦和挪威的标准货币单位〕

Sense.DEF: a South African gold coin
a colourless gas that is found in very small quantities in the air and is used in fluorescent lights and lasers. It is a chemical element: symbol Kr
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 氪〔一种化学元素﹐符号为Kr〕

Sense.TRAN: the written abbreviation of 书面缩写= knot 节
the written abbreviation of 书面缩写= knight 爵士

Sense.DEF: the state of being admired and respected for being important or for doing something important
Sense.EXAMPLE: He acquired kudos just by appearing on television.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他上电视后就出名了。

Sense.DEF: a secret American political organization of Protestant white men who oppose people of other races or religions
Sense.TRAN: 三K党〔美国白种男性新教徒的秘密政治组织﹐反对其他种族或宗教〕

Sense.DEF: a fruit that looks like a very small orange
an ancient Chinese fighting art in which you attack people with your hands and feet
a member of a people living in Iran, Iraq, and Turkey
Sense.TRAN: 库尔德人〔居住在伊朗﹑伊拉克和土耳其〕

Sense.DEF: to keep complaining

Sense.TRAN: the written abbreviation of 书面缩写= kilowatt or 或 kilowatts 千瓦
the written abbreviation of 书面缩写= kilowatt hour or 或 kilowatt hours 千瓦时
